lore: With psalms on their lips, the faithful hurl themselves forward, striking the foe down with the inner strength born of faith in the Emperor.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Even with their dying act, the Sororitas mete out the Emperor’s judgement.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Suffering is a staple prayer for the Adepta Sororitas, and a martyr’s fate only brings greater glory to the God-Emperor.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Infantry or Adepta Sororitas Walker unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement range of your unit selects targets, it must select your unit as the target of its attacks.

lore: The death of a Battle Sister only stirs the survivors to fight harder to exact swift vengeance.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: The pious believe that, in their moment of greatest need, the Emperor protects.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Character unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Discard 1-3 Miracle dice. At the end of the phase, set the last destroyed model from your unit back up on the battlefield, as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy models. Roll one D3, adding 1 to the result for each Miracle dice you discarded. That model is set back up with that number of wounds remaining (up to its starting number of wounds).
restrictionRules: You cannot select Saint Celestine as the target of this Stratagem. You cannot select the same Character as the target of this Stratagem more than once per battle.

lore: Suffering is a staple for the Adepta Sororitas, and a martyr’s fate only brings glory to the God-Emperor.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Infantry or Adepta Sororitas Walker unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement Range of your unit selects its targets, it must select your unit as the target of its attacks.

lore: With the Emperor’s light upon them, the righteous vengeance of the Sisters of Battle burns brighter.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll and, if your unit is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: The enemy must perish, even if we perish with them. The enemy must burn, even if we burn with them.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Vehicle model from your army with the Deadly Demise ability that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not roll one D6 to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your model's Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted.

lore: Even with their dying act, the Adepta Sororitas mete out the Emperor’s judgement.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The death of a Battle Sister only stirs the survivors to fight harder to exact swift vengeance.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: Those seeking absolution in the eyes of the Emperor will gladly give their last drop of blood to defy his enemies.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Penitent unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: Suffering is the penance by which the faithful affirm their devotions. To share in the agonies suffered by the God-Emperor and his saints without embracing death is the mark of fidelity to the Imperial Creed.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Penitent unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Penitent models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

lore: The penitent are full of a burning passion to inflict suffering upon the faithless.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Penitent unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Penitent model in your unit makes a melee attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Agony and guilt drive these sinners forward. Only by meeting the enemy in combat may they find repentance or, failing that, the comfort of death.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just before a Penitent unit from your army Advances.
targetRules: That Penitent unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced. If your unit has the Penitent Engines keyword, do not make an Advance roll for it; instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: The urge to absolve their sins and destroy the enemy drives the penitents to push their tortured bodies beyond their mortal limits.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adepta Sororitas unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adepta Sororitas unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot or declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. If your unit has the Penitent keyword, it is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back instead.

lore: The God-Emperor’s faithful followers, heedless of incoming fire, leap forth to deliver his furious judgement in the press of melee.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Penitent unit from your army that was selected as the target as one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Roll one D6: your unit can be moved a distance in inches up to the result, but it must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding Aircraft). When doing so, models in your unit can be moved within Engagement Range of enemy units.

lore: The Sisters of Battle gird themselves with the strength of their faith. It is a shield of repulsion that rejects the heretical cunning of their enemies.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: As the faithful strike their foes in righteous anger, they feel the Emperor’s hand adding strength to their blows.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of attacks made by those weapons this phase, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model's unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: Congregated within a transport, the Battle Sisters recite bellowing prayers so that the whole vehicle echoes to furious piety.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just before an Adepta Sororitas Transport model from your army Advances.
targetRules: That Adepta Sororitas Transport model.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, you can re-roll Advance rolls made for your Transport, and units can disembark from your Transport even though it Advanced. Units that do so count as having made a Normal move, and cannot declare a charge this turn.

lore: Burn the mutant. Burn the heretic. Burn the witch.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Torrent weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: At close range, the Adepta Sororitas unleash the full devastating potential of their blessed weapons.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 12" that is also within range of an objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of those attacks, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model's unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: The transports of the Adepta Sororitas are mobile shrines. The Sisters within this vehicle recite psalms of righteous hatred and destruction before emerging to obliterate their foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Transport unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: One unit embarked within your Transport can disembark as if it were your Movement phase, and can then shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: There is no armour as resilient as conviction itself.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Adepta Sororitas unit from your army suffers a mortal wound.
targetRules: That Adepta Sororitas unit, or one friendly Adepta Sororitas Jump Pack unit within 3" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds. If you targeted an Adepta Sororitas Jump Pack unit from your army with this Stratagem, then until the end of the phase, while a friendly Adepta Sororitas unit is unit is within 3" of your unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: The Emperor’s radiance shines upon his warriors, magnifying their purity in their darkest hour.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is blessed. While a unit is blessed, it can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: the profile characteristics of its models; the Weapon Skill or Ballistic Skill characteristics of weapons equipped by its models; any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws). If your unit has the Jump Pack keyword, until the end of the turn, while a friendly Adepta Sororitas unit is within 3" of your unit, that friendly unit is also blessed.

lore: The righteous zeal of the Sisters of Battle burns bright as they charge towards their foes.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] ability. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of your unit's attacks this phase, you gain 1 Miracle dice.

lore: The Emperor’s divinity manifests in golden halos, blinding the enemy with radiant light.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, or one friendly Adepta Sororitas Jump Pack unit within 3" of such a unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. If you targeted an Adepta Sororitas Jump Pack unit from your army with this Stratagem, then until the end of the phase, while a friendly Adepta Sororitas unit is unit is within 3" of your unit, each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: With miraculous precision, the blows of the Sisters of Battle strike the weak points of enemy armour.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of any of those attacks, you gain 1 Miracle dice.

lore: On wings of fire do the angelic warriors of the Orders Militant descent to battle.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas Jump Pack unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place to into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: With so singular and fanatical a purpose, the Adepta Sororitas can will their injuries away, at least until the fight is done.
whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound is allocated to an Adepta Sororitas unit from your army.
targetRules: That Adepta Sororitas unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability against mortal wounds. If your unit is Righteous, until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds instead.

lore: No unclean foe can be permitted to stand between the Go‑Emperor’s sworn champions and their oathed duty. They must be struck down with unmerciful fury.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that is Righteous and that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability.

lore: Seizing their moment to drive like a burning blade through the enemy lines and complete their holy mission, these faithful strike with unstoppable might.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTA SORORITAS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, improve the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1. If your unit is Righteous, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 as well.

lore: When exemplars of the Imperial Creed stride to do the God‑Emperor’s will, little can slow their sacred procession.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". When doing so, if your unit is Righteous, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.

lore: Unified in their inviolate dedication to fulfil their oaths to Him on the Throne, the Order’s elite form a rampart of ceramite and unyielding faith to throw back the desperate blows of the foe.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adepta Sororitas unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Such champions of the God‑Emperor never stop fighting or striving for victory, transforming momentary retreats into another opportunity to purge the unclean and press on to their objective.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adepta Sororitas unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adepta Sororitas unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back. If your unit is Righteous, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back instead.

lore: The Adeptus Custodes are individually engineered on a molecular level using secrets of genetic alchemy that render them almost supernaturally resilient.
whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound has been allocated to an Adeptus Custodes model from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana models).
targetRules: That Adeptus Custodes model's unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: The loss of a single Talon of the Emperor is commemorated by the tolling of the Bell of Lost Souls on Terra, and by their comrades’ bloody vengeance on the battlefield.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana units) that is below its Starting Strength.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit. If your unit is Below Half-strength, until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of those melee weapons instead.

lore: Once the Custodians have laid claim to a location, they defend it with incredible tenacity and skill.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Infantry unit from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana units) that is within range of an objective marker you control and that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a melee attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: So widely skilled and studied are the Custodians that, whatever situation they find themselves in, they have the martial wisdom to prevail.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army that Fell Back this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of your turn, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: Simply because the Adeptus Custodes do not stand sentinel over a strategic location or asset, does not mean that it – or any who would threaten it – escapes their gaze.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Battleline unit from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana units) within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: The Shield Hosts have access to stockpiles of ancient and incredibly rare weaponry and ammunition.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability.

lore: Custodians and Null Maidens cover one another seamlessly as they manoeuvre to corner their prey.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes units from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your units are eligible to shoot and/or declare a charge in a turn in which they Fell Back.
restrictionRules: You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: With practiced ease, the Talons of the Emperor establish vicious crossfires to cut the foe apart.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes Infantry units from your army, and one enemy unit that is an eligible target for all of those units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your units can only target that enemy unit, but each time a model in one of your units makes a ranged attack, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1.
restrictionRules: You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: Null Maidens quash the manifestations of witches.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one friendly Anathema Psykana unit within 6" of that Adeptus Custodes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic attacks and mortal wounds.

lore: The Talons of the Emperor tear apart their prey.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes units from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of your units targets an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Wound roll.
restrictionRules: You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: Every move the enemy makes only sees them fall.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes units from your army that are within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your units can make a Normal move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units. You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: It is second nature for Custodes to place themselves between their comrades and potential peril.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one other friendly Adeptus Custodes Infantry unit (excluding Anathema Psykana units) within 6" of that Anathema Psykana Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, any attack that targets your Anathema Psykana unit must instead target your other Adeptus Custodes unit (unless it is not an eligible target).

lore: To overcome the Null Maidens’ aura, enemy psykers overstretch themselves with horrible consequences.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy Psyker unit has either finished using a Psychic ability that targets a unit, or finished making Psychic Attacks.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana unit from your army within 18" of that enemy Psyker unit.
effectRules: That enemy Psyker unit must take a Leadership test. If the test is passed, that Psyker unit is Battle‑shocked; if the test is failed that Psyker unit suffers 3 mortal wounds and is Battle‑shocked.

lore: Null Maidens train to slay psykers with swift martial efficiency, for they know their prey have many weapons beyond just their powers and must not be allowed time or opportunity to employ them.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability, but models in your unit can only target Psyker units with their attacks.

lore: The Vigilators train tirelessly in the art of the swift, beheading strike, with a particular emphasis on the swift elimination of enemy witches.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Vigilators unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, you can re‑roll the Hit roll. If the target of that attack is Battle‑shocked or a Psyker, you can re‑roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Prosecutors can fire psy‑chaff bolts whose esoteric emissions weaken those targets not slain outright.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Prosecutors unit from your army that has just shot.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, while your unit is on the battlefield, that enemy unit is prosecuted. While a unit is prosecuted, each time an Anathema Psykana model makes an attack against that unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. While a Psyker or Battle‑shocked unit is prosecuted, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Witchseekers know their role in combat is to spread indiscriminate carnage through the foe’s ranks.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Witchseekers unit from your army that  has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of Torrent weapons equipped by models in your unit. If such a weapon targets a Psyker or Battle‑shocked unit this phase, add 2 to its Attacks characteristic instead.

lore: Enemies must overcome disorienting waves of revulsion in order to even focus upon Null Maidens.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability, and Battle‑shocked and Psyker models can only select your unit as a target of a ranged attack if they are within 12".

lore: What foe can withstand a warrior who has so tested the defences of the Throneworld itself?
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character unit from your army that has just destroyed the unit you selected at the start of your Command phase as the target of your Assemblage of Might ability.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit on the battlefield. Until the start of your next Command phase, each time an Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army makes an attack that target that enemy unit, add 1 to the Wound roll. In addition, if the destroyed unit was a Character unit, gain 1CP.

lore: The greatest of the Custodians bring incredible reserves of stamina and ability to bear.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Adeptus Custodes Warlord model from your army has used an ability on its datasheet or from an Enhancement that says it can only be used ‘Once per battle'.
targetRules: That Adeptus Custodes Warlord model.
effectRules: Your model can use its ‘Once per battle' ability one additional time during this battle (but not in the same phase).
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

lore: In an age plagued by monsters, when primordial horrors from the darkest void circle Humanity’s dying light, still the Adeptus Custodes stand strong.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Character models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

lore: To lay low the greatest and most terrible monsters and heretics is to earn new names for a Custodian’s mighty tally.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes Character units from your army that have not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Character model in either of your units makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, you can re‑roll the Hit roll and you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

lore: The Custodes do not yield while their duty remains unfulfilled.
whenRules: Fight Phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army that was just destroyed and has not fought this phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not remove your destroyed model from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The greatest Custodians know when it is both their duty and their right to command their comrades.
whenRules: End of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army that is within 2" horizontally and 5" vertically of a friendly unit that it could lead (as described on the Leader section of its datasheet).
effectRules: That Character model attaches to that unit to form an Attached unit. Change the unit's Starting Strength accordingly.
restrictionRules: Your Character model cannot attach to a unit that is already an Attached unit.

lore: The vehicles of the Adeptus Custodes are the finest examples of their kind. Their expertly wrought armoured forms contain ancient and esoteric technology, including auto‑repair subroutines and reactive field generators.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets a model in your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: Even as death’s cold embrace falls upon them, Custodians vent the last of their wrath upon the foe.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if your unit has the Walker keyword. On a 4+, do not remove it from play; The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks (when doing so, it is assumed to have 1 wound remaining), and is then removed from play.

lore: The golden‑armoured onslaught smashes through the enemy line, trapping the foe and preventing their escape.
whenRules: Fight phase, just before an Adeptus Custodes unit from your army Piles In.
targetRules: That Adeptus Custodes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in move, it can move up to D3+3" instead of up to 3".

lore: Armoured in adamantine and possessed of furious machine spirits, the vehicles of the Adeptus Custodes are almost impossible to stop in their tracks.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Vehicle or Adeptus Custodes Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit can move horizontally through models and terrain features.

lore: Custodians coax wrathful fury from their war engines’ machine spirits to hunt down and eliminate their foes at speed. No armour, sorcery or hiding place can shield an enemy from their wrath.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Custodes Vehicle unit from your army Advances.
targetRules: That Adeptus Custodes Vehicle unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced. If your unit has the Walker keyword, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced instead.

lore: The Ten Thousand are relentless in pursuing the Emperor’s foes and thorough in their annihilation. No armour, sorcery or hiding place can shield an enemy from their wrath.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and/or any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.

lore: The Adeptus Custodes smash apart their foes without slowing, securing the Emperor’s realm with bloody efficiency and then advancing to new positions.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army (excluding Anathema Psykana units) within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: In an age plagued by monstrous foes, when primordial horrors from the darkest void circle Humanity’s dying light, still the Adeptus Custodes stand strong.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

whenRules: Any phase, just after an ADEPTUS CUSTODES CHARACTER model from your army has used an ability on its datasheet that states it can only be used 'once per battle'.
targetRules: That ADEPTUS CUSTODES CHARACTER model.
effectRules: Your model can use that 'once per battle' ability one additional time during the battle (but not in the same phase).
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem on the same ADEPTUS CUSTODES CHARACTER model more than once per battle.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS CUSTODES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result if that model has the CHARACTER keyword. On a 4+, do not remove it from play; the destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks (when doing so, it is treated as having 1 wound remaining), and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS CUSTODES unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the PRECISION ability.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ALLARUS CUSTODIANS or AQUILON CUSTODIANS unit from your army that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: That unit is split into separate units, each containing one model. These new units each have a Starting Strength of 1.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an ADEPTUS CUSTODES unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That ADEPTUS CUSTODES unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS CUSTODES unit from your army (excluding VEHICLE units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6".

lore: A haze of deadly radiation hangs around the warriors of the Rad-Cohort, every exhalation they make adding to the isotopic fog, sapping the strength and stamina of those who are not inured to its effects.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army (excluding Vehicle units) that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack is made that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: As Tech-Priests order the purge of an area of the battlefield, rad-bombardments are redoubled in the hopes of turning it into a wasteland.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tech-Priest model from your army and one objective marker within 24" of that model.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within range of that objective marker. On a 4+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound and it must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: Sanctified with the Tri-fold Litany, the most blessed power cells, fuel canisters and solid slugs have spent a decade in the oldest and most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit (excluding Vehicle units), add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that Advanced this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even though it Advanced this turn.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem if the Conqueror Imperative is active for your army.

lore: The sentence for those who dare strike at the Tech-Priests’ holy creations has been carefully prepared in advance and it can be unleashed with an anger born of fanatical faith.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and it can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target. After your unit has finished making these attacks, it is not eligible to shoot again this turn.

lore: The warrior wisdom of experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each pulse of data bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem if the Protector Imperative is active for your army.

lore: By briefly unshielding the most corrosive or irradiated components of their being, the warriors of a Raz-Zone Corps can exhale an isotopic fog, sapping the strength of those not injured to its effects.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army (excluding Vehicle units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks. If that unit is Battleline, you can also target one friendly Skitarii unit (excluding Battleline units) within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets one of those units from your army, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: As Tech-Priests order the purge of an area of the battlefield, hazardous bombardments are redoubled in the hopes of turning it into a wasteland.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tech-Priest model from your army and one objective marker within 24" of that model.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within range of that objective marker. On a 4+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound and must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits, propelling the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase. If that unit is Battleline, you can also target one friendly Skitarii unit (excluding Battleline units) within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time one of those units Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.

lore: Employing targeting data collated by a swarm of servo-skulls released over the enemy’s battle lines, the Machine God’s faithful purge the foe stumbling amidst rad-scourged positions.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase. If that unit is Battleline, you can also target one friendly Skitarii unit (excluding Battleline units) within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of those units makes a ranged attack, if the target of that attack is within your opponent's deployment zone, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

lore: Tri-fold sanctified power cells, fuel canisters and solid slugs have spent a decade in the most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

lore: With a pulse of force-loaded wisdom, microactuators lock into bracing positions, reserve power cells are brought online and the Omnissiah’s holy crusaders are bestowed with a sensation of sacred invulnerability.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks. If that unit is Battleline, you can also target one friendly Skitarii unit (excluding Battleline units) within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in those units from your army have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: Intensifying the locomotive protocols of a war engine - while not dishonouring the machine spirit - is a millennia-proven method to hasten the foe’s demise.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit and add 1 to Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

lore: Encoded with the schemata of the enemy’s fortified battle lines and auto-codified vectors of attack, the Cohort’s war engines are perfectly aligned to deliver the Machine God’s wrath.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army, and one objective marker.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have a Ballistic Skill characteristic of 3+ and the [IGNORES COVER] ability, but they can only target units within range of the selected objective marker.

lore: To invigorate the failing machine spirit of a damaged vehicle is a sacred task, greatly aided by certain data-hymns transmitted in the correct sequence.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army that is below its Starting Strength.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll. If your unit is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Let the unenlightened be cast down! Let all feel the fire of the Motive Force, and may the sacred engines crunch over their weak bones without impediment!
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back and you can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and/or to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

lore: Enhanced static chants can briefly raise a war engine’s machine spirits to exultant heights of cogitation and multi-tactical capacity.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, the Conqueror Imperative and Protector Imperative are both active for your unit.

lore: A protective blessing chanted in pentakairic Novabyte moves machine spirits to defy the most esoteric of assaults.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, which is improved to Feel No Pain 5+ against mortal wounds.

lore: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Machine God’s disciples bolster their spirits - as well as those that inhabit their augmentations - with iron surely.
whenRules: Any phase, just after you allocate a mortal wound to a Cult Mechanicus model from your army.
targetRules: That Cult Mechanicus model's unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Cult Mechanicus models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Cult Mechanicus model in your unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Rousing code in binharic duometer incites fury for the lost fragments of technological lore. In the grip of vengeance, the devoted extend their remaining functions for one last act of retribution.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Cult Mechanicus model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: A cacophonous chorale pours from the emitters and augmented throats of the Cult Mechanicus’ faithful, venerating the Omnissiah in deafening and disconcerting frequencies of praise.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army and one enemy unit within 18" of it.
effectRules: That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test. If that test is failed, until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 6" of one or more Cult Mechanicus models in your unit, adding 1 to the result if that model is an Electro-Priest. On a 5+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

lore: As the cohorts of the Omnissiah recite their dazzling consecration, energy is redirected to infuse masterwork bionics and even the lambent glow of protective fields ignites in a halo of divine defence.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Cult Mechanicus models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: Death is irrelevant compared to the hallowed duty of securing the Omnissiah’s knowledge for future retrieval.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: Retrieval of the most sacred and ancient fragments of technology is embedded in loops of alpha-logic.
whenRules: Fight phase, just before an Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army Consolidates.
targetRules: That Adeptus Mechanicus unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move within range of your Acquisition objective marker.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a unit with this Stratagem if it is within 3" of one or more enemy units.

lore: Mono-task infoslave skulls range ahead to assess potential sites that must be investigated.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tech-Priest model from your army and one objective marker within 24" of that model (excluding your Acquisition objective marker).
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, that objective marker is also considered to be one of your Acquisition objective markers for all rules purposes.

lore: With a surge of targeting data from the war engine as its hatches slam open, the warriors inside pour out with weapons already trained unerringly on the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Acquisition objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The machine spirits of sanctified war engines can be entreated to release clouds of incense laced with radioactive particles, veiling the faithful from the foe.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus Smoke unit within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, both of those units have the Stealth ability and the Benefit of Cover.

lore: Holy data must be hoarded at all costs, and thickly armoured war engines offer swift and secure vaults.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Infantry unit from your army within range of your Acquisition objective marker that was selected as a target of that charge, and one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus Transport.
effectRules: Your unit can embark within that Transport.
restrictionRules: Every model in your unit must be within 3" of that Transport and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

lore: Between their multi-layered bionics and their fanatical faith in the indomitability of these machine-blessings, the most augmented of Skitarii are nigh-impossible to lay low.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Sicarian, Pteraxii or Sydonian unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: Employing directed binharic entanglement to coordinate their motions, paired squads of Skitarii attack with eerie and lethal synchronicity.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two Skitarii units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in both of your units by 1.
restrictionRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).

lore: Binharic imperatives flash through neural architecture, driving augmetic muscle-bundles and auto-actuators into overdrive to propel the Skitarii more swiftly into the fray.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: The swiftest hunters seek to engage foes with the equations of war in their favour, isolating their quarry and dispatching it with ruthless efficiency.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Sicarian, Pteraxii, Sydonian, Ironstrider Ballistarii or Skitarii Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if there are no other enemy units within 6" of the unit targeted by that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: When Skitarii Hunter Cohorts march to war, they do so beneath a shrouding squall of cyber-static and filament-heavy banks of sacred incense.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One SKITARII INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: Taking direct control of their cybernetic soldiers’ manoeuvres, the cohort’s commander sees their withdrawal carried out with such precision that they can be pressed back into service from the most efficacious of attack vectors.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Sicarian units from your army, or one Skitarii Infantry or Skitarii Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: Each unit targeted with this Stratagem must be more than 3" away from all enemy units.

lore: Fresh imperatives flow down from on high. The orders are simple: eliminate the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1, and, if it is a Halo Override unit, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

lore: Experienced Tech‑Priests rapidly analyse the foe’s weaknesses and feed the resultant data to their soldiers, who exploit these flaws to destroy their targets.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: By projecting their consciousness into the minds of tech thralls, a Tech‑Priest may significantly enhance their warriors’ lethality. However, doing so risks overloading their combat units’ more limited neural networks. Such hazards are seen as an opportunity to give one’s life in the name of the Omnissiah.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army.
effectRules:
If your unit is a Halo Override unit, it suffers D3 mortal wounds. Select one Override ability. Until the start of your next Command phase, that ability is active for your unit.

Designer's Note:This means that if the targeted unit already has the Halo Override keyword, it can be affected by multiple Override abilities at the same time, but suffers mortal wounds to do so. Alternatively, if your unit does not have the Halo Override keyword, it instead has the chosen Override ability until the start of your next Command phase, but does not benefit from any other Override abilities that are active.

lore: Urgent imperatives flood into the crew thralls of Skitarius transport units, urging them to deploy their cargo of cybernetic soldiers into the heart of the fight.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Skorpius Dunerider model from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an Adeptus Mechanicus unit disembarks from that model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn. If it is a Halo Override unit, you can re‑roll Desperate Escape tests taken for it.

lore: From their distant strategium pulpit, the Tech‑Priest commander’s guiding hand descends, seizing control of allied minds, steering their troops carefully away from harm whilst maintaining a hail of killing fire.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army makes a Fall Back move.
targetRules: That Adeptus Mechanicus unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back, and, if it is a Halo Override unit, you can re‑roll Desperate Escape tests taken for it.

lore: Tech‑Priest commanders process an overwhelming influx of data screeds, analysing this information to read the flow of battle and coordinate the movements of their thralls.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Infantry unit (excluding Kataphron units) from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or up to 6" instead if it is a Halo Override unit.

lore: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Deathwatch make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Deathwatch unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Only a truly versatile approach to warfare allows the Deathwatch to focus their tactical genius and best the myriad xenos foes they face.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Furor Tactics, Malleus Tactics or Purgatus Tactics. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Deathwatch Mission Tactic is active for your unit instead of any other Deathwatch Mission Tactic that is active for your army, even if you have already selected that Deathwatch Mission Tactic this battle.

lore: Hellfire rounds contain reservoirs of virulent bio-acids that eat away the flesh of their victims in seconds and leave nothing but bubbling gruel.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons (excluding Devastating Wounds weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [ANTI-INFANTRY 2+] and [ANTI-MONSTER 5+] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Dragonfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Dragonfire rounds are designed to explode just before contact, saturating foes in cover with searing gas and flames.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Kraken rounds utilise adamantine cores and improved propellants to penetrate the thickest hide.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 and improve the Range characteristic of those weapons by 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Dragonfire Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: The Ordo Xenos and Deathwatch alike have access to swift gunships and landers that allow for hasty repositioning in the midst of battle.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Inquistor or Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Emitting blasts of light, sound and blinding smoke, these devices disorient the foe.
whenRules: Start of any phase (excluding the Command phase).
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Grenades unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit (excluding Monsters or Vehicles) within 8" of and visible to your unit. That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test and, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Agents of the Ordo Hereticus are unmerciful in meting out what they see as the Emperor’s justice.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

lore: These warriors defend the sanctity of the Emperor’s realm with unwavering determination, no matter the odds stacked against them.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Infantry unit from your army within range of an objective marker and that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: There can be no mercy for heretic leaders.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy Character unit on the battlefield. Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in your unit targets that Character unit, its weapons have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: These ruthless warriors will risk firing into their own ranks if it ensures the deaths of heretics.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit can target enemy units that are within Engagement Range of one or more friendly units with ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons), provided the target is within 12".

lore: Vengeance is swift and unforgiving for those who attack the servants of the Emperor.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an Agents of the Imperium unit from your army is destroyed as the result of an enemy unit's attacks.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that was within 6" of the destroyed unit (you cannot target the destroyed unit with the Stratagem).
effectRules: After the attacking unit has shot, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when resolving those attacks it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).

lore: Whether sanctifying the battlefield against heresy or binding sinister guardian entities to keep watch, this ritual extends its practitioner’s strategic influence.
whenRules: Start of any Command phase.
targetRules: One Inquisitor, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Malleus unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is said to be Warded and remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. While an objective marker is Warded and under your control, enemy Daemon units cannot be set up on the battlefield within 6" of it.

lore: With the correct words of abjuration and banishment, daemons can be driven out of realspace and back into the warp.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Inquisitor, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Malleus unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy Daemon unit within 12" and visible to your unit. That unit must take a Battle-shock test. If that test is failed, then until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Agents of the Imperium unit makes an attack that targets that Daemon unit, that attack has the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: The battle-brothers of the Grey Knights never flee from their daemonic foes, instead merely withdrawing momentarily before striking anew.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: Grey Knights battle plate incorporates litanies of purity, strands of sanctified silver and other sacred wards, whose defences can be further empowered by ritual mantras.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Ancient warding sigils inscribed in shimmering silver, these strange runic designs ward away the hostile energies of the warp.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Ordo Malleus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all Psychic weapons equipped by models in the attacking unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

lore: Specially consecrated and silver-tipped, these bolt shells channel the firer’s innate psychic fury and detonate spectacularly on impact.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] and [PSYCHIC] abilities.

lore: If a high-ranking Imperial agent locates something they wish to acquire, nothing will stop them from unleashing all the forces at their command to seize it.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of an objective marker, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1], [LANCE] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

lore: With command of the orbital engagement zone comes the ability to strike at the enemy from unexpected angles.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Voidfarers Character unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each Agents of the Imperium unit from your army that is arriving from Strategic Reserves this turn can be set up within your opponent's deployment zone (all other restrictions still apply).

lore: Soldiers trained in shipboard warfare and chamber-by-chamber clearance know how best to focus their firepower during close-range firefights.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Voidfarers unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1.

lore: Believing they fight for the safety of the Golden Throne motivates warriors to exceptional deeds.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

lore: These rare protective fields perform microteleport displacements to remove their bearers from harm.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Character unit from your army (excluding Officio Assassinorum units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save and, after the attacking unit has resolved its attacks, unless your unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" (when doing so, models in this unit move as if they have the Fly keyword).

lore: Loyal Imperial warriors will martyr themselves gladly to protect high-ranking Imperial agents.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Attached unit that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack with the [PRECISION] ability is allocated to a Character model in your unit, if there are one or more Bodyguard models in your unit, roll one D6: on a 2+, that attack is allocated to a Bodyguard model of your choice in your unit instead.

lore: If a high-ranking Imperial agent locates something they wish to acquire, nothing will stop them from unleashing all the forces at their command to seize it.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a Character unit, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If that attack is made by an Officio Assassinorum model and it targets the enemy Warlord, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.

lore: Unenhanced mortal bodies are routinely – and unknowingly – dosed with experimental stimulant cocktails that serve to reinforce their resilience, at least in the short term.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Character unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Toughness characteristic of models in your unit. In addition, if it is an Eversor Assassin unit, until the end of the phase, it has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

lore: Aiming concentrated volleys of fire toward an exceptionally resilient foe, these agents erode the will of their target, increasing their vulnerability to the concentrated psychic onslaughts of the Culexus Assassin’s animus speculum.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, if it is a Culexus Assassin unit, until the end of the phase, change the Damage characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit to 3.

lore: Aided by orbiting assets, when the assault begins, voidships flood communication networks with jamming frequencies, fire screening bombardments and otherwise mask the agents’ approach.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18", or, if your unit has the Lone Operative ability, if the attacking model is within 6".

lore: These grenades release thick black smoke and broad-spectrum electromagnetic chaff that disrupt vision and foul augury equipment upon detonating.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Grenades or Vindicare Assassin unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge and is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, subtract 1 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit, or, if your unit is a Vindicare Assassin, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit instead.

lore: The eyes of the Officio Assassinorum are everywhere. As the foe turns to flee, the noose tightens, agents already forewarned of enemy movements and moving swiftly to cut off all avenues of retreat.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Charge phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Infantry unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can declare a charge. When doing so, you must select one or more of those enemy units as the targets of that charge, and your unit does not receive a Charge bonus this turn. In addition, if it is a Callidus Assassin unit and it makes a Charge move as a result of this Stratagem, until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASURYANI unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI unit from your army and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
effectRules: If your ASURYANI unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an ASURYANI unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That ASURYANI unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the SUSTAINED HITS 1 ability while targeting an enemy unit within 12". If such a weapon already has that ability, until the end of the phase, each time an attack is made with that weapon, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase, just after an ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding AIRCRAFT, ASURMEN and WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) has shot.
targetRules: That ASURYANI unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6+1".
restrictionRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
