targetRules: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that was set up on the battlefield from Reserves this turn and has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: End of your Shooting phase or the end of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 7".

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

whenRules: The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army in Reserves.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when setting up your unit on the battlefield from Reserves, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units. When doing so, if your unit is set up within 9" horizontally of one or more enemy units, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound is allocated to an AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army.
targetRules: That AELDARI VEHICLE unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One AELDARI TRANSPORT unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, units can disembark from your TRANSPORT after it has Advanced. Units that do so count as having made a Normal move that phase, and cannot declare a charge in the same turn, but can otherwise act normally.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY Falls Back.
targetRules: That AELDARI VEHICLE unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Start of the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY and is in Strategic Reserves.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Deep Strike ability. When your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units, but if it does, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge. In addition, if your unit is a TRANSPORT, each unit that disembarks from it this turn must be set up more than 6" horizontally from all enemy units and until the end of the turn, is not eligible to declare a charge.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit is selected to shoot, you can re‑roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll and one Damage roll made for a model in your unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, you can select one of those rolls to re‑roll before moving onto the next step of the attack sequence.

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY and was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One AELDARI PSYKER model from your army and one friendly WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit within 12" of it that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit visible to your PSYKER model. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the Armour Penetration and/or Damage characteristics of that attack.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the DEVASTATING WOUNDS ability.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHGUARD or WRAITHLORD unit from your army and one ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, your WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHGUARD or WRAITHLORD unit is considered to be within 12" of your PSYKER model for the purposes of the Psychic Guidance and Spirit Guides abilities.

whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One WRAITHBLADES or WRAITHGUARD unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit and roll one D6 for each WRAITHBLADES model in your unit, or roll four D6 if your unit has the WRAITHLORD keyword, or roll six D6 if your unit has the WRAITHKNIGHT keyword: for each 3+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One HARLEQUINS CHARACTER model from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: At the end of the phase, set your model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with half of its starting number of wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: Each model can only be targeted with this Stratagem once per battle.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One HARLEQUINS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a HARLEQUINS unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That HARLEQUINS unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One TROUPE unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

whenRules: End of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One HARLEQUINS INFANTRY or HARLEQUINS MOUNTED unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that only targets one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge.
restrictionRules: Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One HARLEQUINS unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of one or more objective markers, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: If your unit is within range of one or more objective markers, until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army
targetRules: One WAR WALKERS unit from your army.
effectRules: After that enemy unit has finished making its attacks, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when resolving those attacks, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One STORM GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit. Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Dire AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the PISTOL ability.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One GUARDIANS unit from your army.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. When doing so, return every destroyed GUARDIANS model to your unit.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One YNNARI unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of one or more objective markers you controlled at the end of the previous phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Select one of those objective markers. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One YNNARI INFANTRY or YNNARI MOUNTED unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a YNNARI INFANTRY unit from your army has selected its targets.
targetRules: That YNNARI INFANTRY unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1. If your unit is below its Starting Strength, you can re‑roll the Hit roll instead.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One YNNARI unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One YNNARI unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the LETHAL HITS and IGNORES COVER abilities

whenRules: End of your opponent's Shooting phase.
targetRules: One YNNARI unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units), if one or more models in that unit were destroyed this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to your model. That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll and subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that has not been selected to move this phase and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is not eligible to be selected to move.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the IGNORES COVER ability and each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6: for each 3+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack's Ballistic Skill, Weapon skill, Strength, Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics and/or any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can remove one Aspect Shrine token your unit has (see datasheets). Then, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if you removed an Aspect Shrine token during this usage of this Stratagem. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ASURYANI unit from your army and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
effectRules: If your ASURYANI unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One AVATAR OF KHAINE model from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your model's Wailing Doom ranged weapon has a Range characteristic of 18" and a Damage characteristic of 8.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASPECT WARRIORS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can remove one Aspect Shrine token your unit has (see datasheets). Then, select one of the following abilities, or select two of the following abilities if you removed an Aspect Shrine token during this usage of this Stratagem: IGNORES COVER, LETHAL HITS, SUSTAINED HITS 1. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected abilities.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: All models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

lore: The Aeldari can process battlefield events at baffling speed, making their physical reactions so fast that they are able to dodge attacks that would hit any other target.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army (excluding Wraith Construct units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: The Aeldari are forever elusive, and their actions are unpredictable and deceptive. What appears to be a full retreat one moment is revealed as the prelude to a devastating attack the next.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Aeldari unit from your army makes a Fall Back move.
targetRules: That Aeldari unit.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge this turn even though it Fell Back.

lore: Grace in battle and merciless efficiency are prized virtues in craftworld armies. Like the shimmering blades of Khaine, the Asuryani carve through the ranks of their enemies.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: The Aeldari are masters of hit-and-run tactics, engaging a target with a flurry of shots before quickly manoeuvring into cover or out of sight.
whenRules: End of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move. It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move.
restrictionRules: You cannot select an Aircraft unit or a unit within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and until the end of the turn, the unit you selected is not eligible to declare a charge.

lore: The well-trained Aeldari are able to lay down a hail of fire from their weapons, their superior reflexes allowing them to track even the most sudden movement and place every shot perfectly.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2.

lore: The Aeldari are masters of misdirection, and they employ holo-emitters and psychic phantasms to fool enemy scouts.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and until the end of the turn, you cannot target that unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem.

lore: The Astra Militarum can call upon a nearly inexhaustible supply of warriors.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Regiment unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with all of its wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed Character units to Attached units.

lore: Astra Militarum combat doctrine utilises the concentration of focused firepower to hammer the foe from multiple angles.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Regiment or Squadron unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: After your unit has resolved its attacks, select one enemy unit that was targeted by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is made against that enemy unit by a Regiment or Squadron model from your army, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Ordered to focus a rapid and repeated volley of fire, soldiers are able to rattle even the staunchest foe with a blizzard of shots.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles).
effectRules: If your Astra Militarum unit scores one or more hits against that enemy unit this phase, until the end of your opponent’s next turn, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Skilled in coordinating their targeting with forward spotter elements, this regiment’s artillery crews are capable of devastating precision shelling.
whenRules: Start of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum unit from your army equipped with a vox-caster, and one enemy unit that is visible to that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an Astra Militarum model from your army makes an attack with an Indirect Fire weapon that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking model is Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Hit roll.

lore: This officer is known for their strategic excellence, as are those they command. Honed over many years, their curt, well-established battle cant is wielded with consummate efficiency, reinforced by the inspirational example they themselves set.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Command phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Officer unit from your army.
effectRules: Your Officer can issue one Order as if it were your Command phase.
restrictionRules: Your Officer cannot issue that Order to a Battle-shocked unit.

lore: The tanks of the Imperial Guard are armoured not only in reinforced plas-steel, but with devout faith in the Emperor and utter contempt for their foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One INFANTRY REGIMENT unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with all of its wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units. You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Any number of ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER units from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your OFFICERS can issue Orders to REGIMENT units and SQUADRON units.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One REGIMENT or SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Command phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER unit from your army.
effectRules: Your OFFICER can issue one Order as if it were your Command phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result if it is a REGIMENT model. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Start of your Command phase.
targetRules: One INFANTRY OFFICER model from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when your model issues the Move! Move! Move! Order, it can issue that Order to any number of eligible friendly INFANTRY REGIMENT units, regardless of range to your model.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes an attack that targets a visible enemy unit within 12", you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One PLATOON unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units are not considered to be within Engagement Range of your unit for the purposes of selecting targets of ranged weapons. Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model loses a wound, while that model's unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6: on a 4+, one model from your unit is destroyed after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One PLATOON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit while targeting an enemy unit within half range.

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One PLATOON unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit ends a Charge move within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

lore: The Astra Militarum can call upon a nearly inexhaustible supply of warriors.
whenRules: Your Reinforcements step.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Infantry unit from your army that is in Reserves and has the Deep Strike ability.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.

lore: At the risk of permanently burning out power packs, hot-shot weaponry can be temporarily overcharged to provide additional punch at the crucial moment.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Militarum Tempestus or Kasrkin unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of hot-shot lascarbines, hot-shot lasguns, hot-shot laspistols, hot-shot marksman rifles, hot-shot volley guns and sentry hot-shot volley guns equipped by models in your unit by 1.

lore: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Released in a swarm from a modified Valkyrie gunship, high-altitude servo-skulls analyse targeting data from the ongoing fight and then provide updated firing solutions to the troops on the ground.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase, just after an Astra Militarum Infantry unit from your army has shot.
targetRules: That Astra Militarum Infantry unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks that is visible to your unit. Until the end of the phase, that enemy unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.

lore: Such swift manoeuvres are vital to retaining command of the developing tactical situation, whether gunships are peeling off to strike at the enemy from a fresh angle or infantry being extracted by dropcraft for rapid redeployment.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, if all of its models have the Deep Strike ability, or one Valkyrie unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Circling Aeronautica Imperialis strike fighters wait above to launch strafing runs should the attack falter. In extremis, these assets can be called down upon Imperial positions in danger of being overrun, affording soldiers the desperate dignity of taking their enemies with them into death.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Regiment Infantry unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds. Then, your unit suffers 3D3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One INFANTRY OFFICER unit from your army embarked within a TRANSPORT. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it is embarked within a TRANSPORT.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can issue Orders even though it is not on the battlefield, and it can issue Orders to ASTRA MILITARUM TRANSPORT units from your army (excluding TITANIC units) regardless of the distance to and from your unit's TRANSPORT.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this phase.
effectRules: Your INFANTRY unit can make a Normal move of up to D6".

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One TRANSPORT unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
effectRules: Your TRANSPORT can make a Normal move of up to 6".

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, after an enemy unit has selected targets for its charge but before it makes a Charge move.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: Provided your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and every model in your unit is within 3" of an ASTRA MILITARUM TRANSPORT from your army, it can embark within that TRANSPORT.

whenRules: End of your opponent's turn.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army.
effectRules: Provided your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and every model in your unit is within 3" of an ASTRA MILITARUM TRANSPORT from your army, it can embark within that TRANSPORT.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).
effectRules: Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding ONE SHOT weapons) have the HAZARDOUS ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack's Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.
targetRules: That SQUADRON unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That SQUADRON unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One PLATOON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the PRECISION ability.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One PLATOON unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit, and is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Reinforcements step.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" of your unit.

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY or ASTRA MILITARUM MOUNTED unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and each time an enemy model makes an attack, if your unit is the closest eligible target, subtract 1 from the hit roll.

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM GRENADES unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit selects your unit as the target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).

whenRules: End of your opponent's turn.
targetRules: One ASTRA MILITARUM MOUNTED or ASTRA MILITARUM WALKER unit from your army that is wholly within 10" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: The belligerency and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Black Templars channel their fervour into a hate-fuelled flurry of blows.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If the Suffer Not The Unclean to Live vow is active for your army, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack as well.

lore: Every blow struck against a Black Templar is answered in kind. Even as they are laid low, their blades still lash out at the enemies of the divine Emperor.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the Uphold the Honour of the Emperor vow is active for your army. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The magnetic force of this Black Templar’s oratory inspires his fellow warriors to swear great vows, even in the midst of the battle.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one Templar Vow that is not active for your army. Until the start of your next Command phase, while that Character is leading a unit, models in that unit gain the benefits of that vow in addition to the vow selected to be active for your army at the start of the battle.

lore: Glowing blades and revving chainswords close off the foe’s every avenue of escape.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, when an enemy unit (excluding Vehicles and Monsters) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the Accept Any Challenge, No Matter the Odds vow is active for your army. On a 4+, that enemy unit cannot Fall Back this phase and must Remain Stationary. Otherwise, that enemy unit can Fall Back this phase, but if it does, all models in that unit must take a Desperate Escape test.

lore: With a zealous cry, the Black Templars press forward towards victory.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", but it must end that move closer to the enemy unit that just shot. If the Abhor the Witch, Destroy the Witch vow is active for your army, your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead, but it must end that move either closer to the enemy unit that just shot, or closer to the closest enemy Psyker unit.

lore: The Black Templars fight on through even the most grievous wounds to body and mind.
whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound is allocated to an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: There is nowhere that the architects of heresy can hide from the righteous judgement of the Black Templars.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: All the enemy’s skill, cunning and trickery come to naught in the face of the Black Templars’ direct and unrelenting brutality.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1 and you can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: that attack’s Weapon Skill characteristic; the Hit roll; the Wound roll.

lore: The sheer momentum and ferocity of so many charging, armoured killers are almost impossible to stop, carrying them forward through rank after rank of the heretical foe.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase and is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when determining which models in your unit are eligible to fight, any models in it that are within 3" of one or more enemy models are eligible to fight. When resolving those attacks, such models can target one of those enemy units that is within 3" of them and within Engagement Range of their unit.

lore: In the crucial moment, these battle‑brothers switch to the most apposite devotional litany just as they might select the correct weapon from the Chapter’s armouries.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry or Adeptus Astartes Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Chorus of Relentless Hate, Rite of Perfervid Wrath or Chant of Deathless Devotion Litany. Until the end of the battle round, that Litany is active for your unit instead of any other Litany that is active for your army.

lore: Sanguinius’ sons are blessed with the spiritual fortitude of their Primarch.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army has a mortal wound allocated to it.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their enhanced physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Sons of Sanguinius may embrace the Red Thirst but for a moment, if the need arises.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was just charged by an enemy unit.
effectRules: Select either the Strength or Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit. Until the end of the turn, add 1 to the selected characteristic. You can instead choose for your unit to give in to the Red Thirst; if it does, it becomes Battle‐shocked (but the effects of this Stratagem still apply to it) and until the end of the turn, add 1 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit.

lore: In times of great desperation, fury and ferocity can be a warrior’s strongest allies.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LANCE] or [LETHAL HITS] abilities. Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability. You can instead choose for your unit to give in to the Red Thirst; if it does, then it becomes Battle‐shocked (but the effects of this Stratagem still apply to it) and until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] and [LETHAL HITS] abilities.

lore: The Blood Angels enact a sweeping advance.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army has Advanced.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to either shoot or declare a charge, even though it Advanced. You can instead choose for your unit to give in to the Red Thirst; if it does, it becomes Battle‐shocked (but the effects of this Stratagem still apply to it) and until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to both shoot and declare a charge, even though it Advanced.

lore: When Blood Angels execute a tactical withdrawal it is but a prelude to a renewed assault.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to either shoot or declare a charge even though it Fell Back. You can instead choose for your unit to give in to the Red Thirst; if it does, it becomes Battle‐shocked (but the effects of this Stratagem still apply to it) and until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to both shoot and declare a charge, even though it Fell Back.

lore: Even in death, the Lost bring victory to their Chapter.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Death Company unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their enhanced physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: These battle‐brothers have already accepted their deaths. They now seek to strike one last, telling blow against the enemy.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Death Company unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if your unit is within 12" of one or more friendly Chaplain models; on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The Lost push towards new foes, the bloodlust in their veins enhancing their preternatural speed.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Death Company unit from your army, just before that unit Piles‐in.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‐in move, it can move up to D3+3" instead of up to 3". If your unit is within 12" of one or more friendly Chaplain models, or if it is below Starting Strength, it can move up to 6" instead. In either case, it can only do so provided your unit ends that Pile‐in move in Unit Coherency and within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: The Lost are consumed utterly by rage.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Death Company unit from your army that is below Starting Strength and has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Attacks, Stength and Armour Penetration characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 and, unless your unit is within 12" of one or more friendly Chaplain models, until the end of the phase, those weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

lore: So lost to rage are the Death Company that they surge unstoppably into battle, eagerly outpacing their brothers.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Death Company unit from your army Advances.
targetRules: That Death Company unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced. If your unit is within 12" of one or more friendly Chaplain models, or it is below its Starting Strength, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: The Sanguinary Guard exemplify the noble heritage of Sanguinius, leaping to avenge their battle‐brothers without hesitation.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Sanguinary Guard unit makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re‐roll the Hit roll and you can re‐roll the Wound roll.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their enhanced physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Blood Angels would gladly put themselves in harm’s way to protect others, just as Sanguinius sacrificed his own life.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement Range of your unit selects its targets, it must select your unit as the target of all of its attacks.

lore: The Blood Angels are mighty warriors indeed, and wield their gilded and shimmering blades with consummate skill.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] and [PRECISION] abilities.

lore: The Blood Angels are masters of aerial assault, leaping from airborne transports with jump packs roaring to plunge into the heat of battle.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: The roar of the Blood Angels jump packs is as a funeral dirge to their foes.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army Advances or Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

lore: The Blood Angels would gladly put themselves in harm’s way to protect others, exemplifying the sacrifice of Sanguinius.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Adeptus Astartes unit makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your Character unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Sons of Sanguinius constantly push towards new foes, the bloodlust singing in their veins unleashed in a controlled dynamism.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army, just before that unit Consolidates.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move in Unit Coherency and within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: In times of great desperation, fury and ferocity can be a warrior’s strongest allies.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] and [LETHAL HITS] abilities.

lore: Imminent death does not prevent a Space Marine from enacting his final justice upon the enemies of the Imperium.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Blood Angels are loathe to resort to the defensive strategies favoured by other Chapters, and a tactical withdrawal is but a prelude to re-entering the fray.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even though it Fell Back this phase.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Keeping the beast within under tight control, the Blood Angels nonetheless tap into that inner rage and shackle it to their precisely aimed blows.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. If your unit is a Character unit, until the end of the phase, those weapons have the [LANCE] ability as well.

lore: In this most desperate moment of need, a lone battle‑brother rises to the challenge as a true inheritor of the Angel’s legacy.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one non‑Character model in your unit. Until the start of your next Command phase, your model has the Character keyword.

lore: Knowing instinctively that the pivotal moment has arrived, these battle‑brothers aim and hammer their foes with unrelenting volleys.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

lore: The enemy is engulfed in a soul‑deep shadow for just a moment, as though mighty wings have spread above them and marred their vision with occluding darkness.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: In the face of encroaching doom, as the world seems to burn around them, these scions of Sanguinius leap high into the tormented heavens, ready to strike down with vengeful fury upon the enemy teeming below.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army. You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, unless it is The Sanguinor.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Daemons instinctively feel the need to despoil and corrupt every corner of realspace, the better to sustain their otherworldly forms.
whenRules: Start of any Command phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is said to be Corrupted and remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. In addition, while an objective marker is Corrupted and under your control, the area of the battlefield within 6" of that objective marker is considered to be within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

lore: The swelling fear of their mortal prey serves as an intoxicating elixir to the daemonic followers, each draught invigorating their forms with deadly power.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1. In addition, until the end of the phase, each time such a weapon targets a unit that is Battle-shocked, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: The winds of the warp blow strong, invigorating daemonkind and lending them supernatural speed and ferocity.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even if it Advanced this turn.

lore: Ever lurking in the warp, daemons will wait until the barriers between realms thin before tearing their way into realspace.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One LEGIONES DAEMONICA unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.

lore: When the energies of the warp bleed into realspace, the Legiones Daemonica can rip open portals in seeming thin-air, returning to their hellscapes only to rematerialise amidst their foes a heartbeat later.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s turn.
targetRules: Up to two Legiones Daemonica units from your army that are within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, or one other Legiones Daemonica unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. They will arrive back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability.
restrictionRules: You cannot target units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units with this Stratagem.

lore: Daemons are madness given form. Their very bodies are fashioned from the stuff of the warp, and are difficult to destroy through conventional means.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an invulnerable saving throw is made for a model in your unit, re-roll a saving throw of 1.

lore: The daemons of Slaanesh are so enraptured by the physical sensations of their victims that they even steal one another’s agonies to enjoy.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an attack or mortal wound is allocated to a model in a Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit from your army (excluding Monsters).
targetRules: That Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit.
effectRules: Select one other friendly Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit within 12" of your unit. Until the end of the phase, while the selected unit is on the battlefield, each time a model in your unit would lose a wound, inflict 1 mortal wound on the selected unit instead.

lore: These daemons perceive with absolute clarity whereabouts on their victims’ bodies they must strike to inflict the greatest possible excess of suffering.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh Monster unit or up to two Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh units (excluding Monsters) from your army that have not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of those units makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: This entity causes the battlefield to flicker wildly between the debauched Slaaneshi Warp interstice and the most brutally mundane reality, faster than even supernatural senses can perceive. The result is a psychically devastating barrage of excess and deprivation.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh Monster unit from your army that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: Each unit on the battlefield that is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if they are Below Half‑strength.

lore: Against their wills, enemy combatants find themselves wishing for the daemons of Slaanesh to draw closer. It is child’s play for the daemons of Slaanesh to harness such strong emotions and transform them into manifest reality.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through terrain features.

lore: The cavorting approach of Slaaneshi daemons is hypnotic and enthralling. It is a whirling carousel of eye‑searing colours and flashing blades that tempt mortals to reach out with trembling eagerness until they can just reach.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, then roll one D6 for each model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit, or roll six D6 instead if your unit is a Monster unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: Sensation gushes relentlessly into the overwhelming minds of the enemy until their souls strain fit to burst. Barely able to think or function, they recoil in their desperate need to stem the unstoppable tide.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Slaanesh unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: The attacking unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from the result. If that test is passed, until the end of the phase, each time a model in the attacking unit makes an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. If that test is failed, in addition to being Battle‑shocked, until the end of the phase, the attacking unit cannot select your unit as the target of any attacks. That unit can then select new targets for any attacks that targeted your unit.

lore: The daemons of Tzeentch are so enraptured by the physical sensations of their victims that they even steal one another’s agonies to enjoy.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch Monster unit from your army that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: Select No Man’s Land or your opponent’s deployment zone, or spend one Flux token and select both. Until the end of the phase, the selected areas of the battlefield are within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

lore: Warpflame is as changeable as the monsters who wield it, capable of easily burning through ceramite plates or reinforced hulls when desired.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight that phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of weapons equipped by models in your unit, or spend one Flux token and add 3 to the Strength characteristic of those weapons and improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of those weapons by 1 instead.

lore: The very stuff of reality flickers like a candle flame in a gale, frustrating even the most skilful sworders as they strike at rippling illusions.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Roll one D6, then you can spend one Flux token to re‑roll the result: until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, on an unmodified Hit roll (after any re‑roll) of that result, the attack sequence ends, even if the original Hit roll would have been a Critical Hit.

lore: Between one heartbeat and the next, the daemons of Tzeentch vanish as though they were never there. Yet this jarring respite will last only long enough for their victims to question their sanity before the onslaught begins anew.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: These daemons care little for who they engulf in their infernal fires, only that destruction and chaos are wrought.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units are not considered to be within Engagement Range of your unit for the purposes of selecting targets for, and resolving attacks with, ranged weapons. Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model is destroyed while its unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6: on a 5+, your unit suffers 1 mortal wound after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks.

lore: Between one heartbeat and the next, the daemons of Tzeentch vanish as though they were never there. Yet this jarring respite will last only long enough for their victims to question their sanity before the onslaught begins anew.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Tzeentch unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Even the banishing blow is often not enough to prevent the daemons of Khorne from lashing out to take bloody vengeance as they discorporate.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The manifest will to run down and slaughter their prey allows the daemons of Khorne to surge through physical barriers as though they did not exist, falling upon their victims like bloody phantasms.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through terrain features.

lore: The iron reek of mortal blood pulsing through living veins fires the unnatural senses of Khorne’s daemons, drawing them on all the swifter to tear, slay, and hack skulls from necks for mighty Khorne.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne Infantry or Legiones Daemonica Khorne Mounted unit from your army (excluding units that Fell Back this turn) that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that is not within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army and is within 8" of and visible to your unit. Roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: The scorn of these daemons for the blasts and blades of the weakling foe manifests as flowing brass armour that enfolds their corporeal forms and denies all but the most dolorous blows.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne unit from your army that has not been selected to charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Khorne’s daemons know only hatred and contempt for those who flee from combat and will distort reality itself to keep such cowards trapped in the endless battle they sought to escape.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit Falls Back.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne unit from your army that is within 6" of that enemy unit and would be eligible to declare a charge against that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that targets only that enemy unit, and you resolve that charge. Note that even if that charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

lore: The scorn of these daemons for the blasts and blades of the weakling foe manifests as flowing brass armour that enfolds their corporeal forms and denies all but the most dolorous blows.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Khorne unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a Save characteristic of 3+.

lore: Repugnant filth wells from the weapons, gaping maws and open wounds of these daemons, slopping across the foe and causing swift and virulent rot wherever it finds the slightest way in.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: A plague of waking nightmares races through the enemy ranks, leaving foes reeling in the grip of nauseating visions that curdle into soul-destroying reality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

lore: As the power of the Plague God saturates the battlefield, fresh daemonic life blooms from the septic corpse mulch that bubbles underfoot.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle unit from your army that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: Return up to 1 destroyed model to your unit, or up to D3 destroyed models instead if your unit is a Battleline unit, with their full wounds remaining. If it is a Monster unit, one model in your unit regains up to D3+1 lost wounds instead.

lore: Rather than lumber across the battlefield, these daemons rot away to nothing before hatching anew from canker blooms wherever they wish to be.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through terrain features.

lore: With the battlefield swathed in an occluding miasma of unreality, Nurgle’s daemons may loom out of the haze, solidify from amidst thrumming fly clouds or even rise out of the filth without warning.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal move, add 5" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Even as one band of foes gives in to despair, their sorrows spread like a virus to the minds and souls of others, the enemy’s woes multiplying by the moment.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Command phase, before selecting any targets for the Melancholic Miasma Detachment rule.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica Nurgle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, after an enemy unit takes a Battle‑shock test as a result of the Melancholic Miasma Detachment rule, select one other enemy unit within 9" of your unit; that enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test.

whenRules: Any phase, just after a SHADOW LEGION unit from your army is destroyed, before removing the last model in that unit from the battlefield and before rolling any dice for the Deadly Demise ability.
targetRules: That SHADOW LEGION unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is within Engagement Range of the last model in your unit, adding 2 to the result if your unit has the SLAANESH keyword: on a 4-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6+, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One SHADOW LEGION unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the LANCE ability. If your unit has the KHORNE keyword, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of those weapons by 1 as well.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One SHADOW LEGION unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to 3 lost wounds. In addition, If your unit has the TZEENTCH keyword, return up to one destroyed model (excluding CHARACTER models) to your unit with its full wounds remaining.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Up to one SHADOW LEGION HERETIC ASTARTES unit from your army and up to one SHADOW LEGION LEGIONES DAEMONICA unit from your army. You can only select units that arrived from Reserves this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your selected units have the IGNORES COVER ability.

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit declares a charge.
targetRules: One SHADOW LEGION unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
