effectRules: Until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit. In addition, if your unit has the NURGLE keyword, that enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to one SHADOW LEGION HERETIC ASTARTES unit from your army and up to one SHADOW LEGION LEGIONES DAEMONICA unit from your army. You can only select units that are not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove those selected units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.

lore: War Dog pilots encircle their terrified victims then attack in a ferocious mass.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two or more War Dog units from your army and one enemy unit that is an eligible target for each of those selected War Dog units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, the selected War Dog units can only target that enemy unit, but all weapons equipped by those War Dog models gain the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked, until the end of the phase, each time a selected War Dog model makes an attack against that enemy unit, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Chaos Knight pilots refuse to yield while foes remain to be slain, disdainfully ignoring those who succumb to fear.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your model has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against attacks made by Battle-shocked models.

lore: Shrieking with ghoulish hunger, daemonic entities descend in a tatterwinged whirlwind to rend apart the souls of those enemies who show even a moment’s fear. The soul-raptors tear apart their victims’ animus and, as they feed, this life force is channelled to regenerate the battle damage or heal the pilot of the Knight in which these creatures roost.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that is within 12" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6. For each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound and this model regains up to 1 lost wound.

lore: The War Dogs of the Chaos Knights are more terrified of their lords than they are the enemy, and they heed their masters well, for they know the price of disobedience or disloyalty.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Abhorrent model from your army and up to three War Dog models from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, those War Dog models count as being within range of any Aura abilities that Abhorrent model has.

lore: Like dark phantoms, some Chaos Knights can move through solid walls without hindrance.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: Up to two War Dog models from your army or one Titanic Chaos Knights model from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, the selected models can move horizontally through models and terrain features as if they were not there.

lore: Ectoplasmic blood surges hot through glowing conduits as the Chaos Knight feeds power to its shield emitters.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, that Chaos Knights model has a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, the enemy unit that destroyed your unit is Marked. Each time a DAMNED model from your army makes an attack that targets a Marked unit, that attack has the LETHAL HITS ability.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One DAMNED unit (excluding ACCURSED CULTISTS) from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with all of its wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle. This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army has fought.
targetRules: That CHAOS KNIGHTS unit.
effectRules: If one or more models were destroyed as a result of those attacks, your unit regains up to D3 lost wounds. If one or more models from Battle‑shocked units were destroyed as a result of those attacks, your unit regains up to D3+2 lost wounds instead.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army Advances or Falls Back.
targetRules: That unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DAMNED unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units are not considered to be within Engagement Range of your unit for the purposes of selecting targets of ranged weapons. Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model loses a wound, while that model's unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6: on a 4+, one model from your unit is destroyed after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Select one DAMNED unit from your army that is not Battle‑shocked, not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is within 6" of your unit. That DAMNED unit can make a Normal move of up to 6", but it must end this move closer to that enemy unit than when it started the move.

whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that is within 12" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6. For each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound and this model regains up to 1 lost wound.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS model from your army that made a Charge move this turn and has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by your model by 1. After your model has finished making its attacks this phase, if it destroyed one or more enemy units this phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your model must take a Battle-shock test.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your model has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against attacks made by Battle-shocked models.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ABHORRENT model from your army and up to three WAR DOG models from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, those WAR DOG models count as being within range of any Aura abilities that ABHORRENT model has.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: Up to two WAR DOG units from your army or one TITANIC CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of your units makes a move, it can move through models and terrain features. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed (the Super-heavy Walker ability does not apply while using this Stratagem).

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Stealth ability, and each time an attack targets your unit, models in it have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army that is within range of one or more objective markers you control.
effectRules: Select one of those objective markers. That objective marker remains under your control, with a Level of Control of 5 (unless it would otherwise be higher), until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Any phase, just after a CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army is destroyed.
targetRules: That CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: When rolling to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your unit's Deadly Demise ability, that model's Deadly Demise ability inflicts mortal wounds on a D6 roll of a 4+ instead of on a 6.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy MONSTER or VEHICLE unit. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1 and re-roll a Wound roll of 1. Each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, if that enemy unit is TITANIC, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

whenRules: Fight phase, just before a CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army consolidates.
targetRules: That CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Consolidates, models in it can move an additional 3" as long as your unit can end that move within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army ends a Normal move.
targetRules: That CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) that your unit moved over during that move and roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If one or more models are destroyed as a result of this Stratagem, that enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.

whenRules: Start of the Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One WAR DOG CHARACTER unit from your army.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. Each friendly WAR DOG unit that is within 6" of your unit and is Battle-shocked must take a Leadership test; if that test is passed, that unit is no longer Battle-shocked.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two or more WAR DOG units from your army within Engagement Range of the same enemy unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of those WAR DOG units. Until the end of the phase, models in those WAR DOG units can only target that enemy unit, but each time a model in one of those WAR DOG units makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a WAR DOG unit from your army Falls Back
targetRules: That WAR DOG unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after a WAR DOG unit from your army is destroyed.
targetRules: That WAR DOG unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Before resolving your unit's Deadly Demise ability, it can either shoot or fight. When doing so, it must target only the enemy unit that just destroyed it, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target. After it has done so and after any Consolidation moves have been made, resolve your unit's Deadly Demise ability as normal.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One WAR DOG unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One WAR DOG unit from your army that is wholly within 12" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: End of any phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that is not Empowered.
effectRules: Your unit makes a Malefic Surge.
restrictionRules: You cannot select the same unit as the target of this Stratagem more than once per battle round.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your Command phase, just after a CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit from your army makes a Malefic Surge.
targetRules: That CHAOS KNIGHTS CHARACTER unit.
effectRules: Select one objective marker your unit is within range of that you control. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: After your unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test; if the test is failed, until the end of your opponent's next turn, it is aflame. While a unit is aflame, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the IGNORES COVER ability.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One CHAOS KNIGHTS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, that CHAOS KNIGHTS model has a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

lore: With gruesome offerings and ritualised promises, the Chaos Space Marines seek the protection of their infernal masters.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Fervent mortal followers flock to the champions of Chaos, damning their souls seeking promises of dark power.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Chaos Undivided unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Heretic Astartes are fuelled by hate, a searing spite that burns fiercely within them unto the very moment of death. Even as their life force pours from terrible wounds, this loathing can drive them to fight on in a second wind of wrath. Those Heretic Astartes in thrall to the Blood God feel this enmity to an even greater extent than others, exploding with violence just as the enemy think they have finally ended them.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if it is a Khorne unit: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: With the Dark Gods and the powers of the warp on their side, Chaos Space Marines can cheat death altogether. Their foes look on in horror as killing wounds knit themselves together in a cacophony of hideous cracks and squelches and shattered armour reforms. After such a blessing, the Heretic Astartes are both something far greater, and far less, than what they once were.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to 3 lost wounds. In addition, if your unit is a Tzeentch unit below its Starting Strength, one destroyed model (excluding Character models) is returned to your unit with its full wounds remaining.

lore: Some Heretic Astartes appear to move with a speed that should be impossible, weapons and bodies seemingly moving from one place to another in the blink of an eye.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. In addition, if your unit is a Slaanesh unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Choking fogs echoing with the screams of tortured souls; dense clouds of bloated flies; deluges of bloody rain; whirlwinds of coruscating flames blazing in a thousand hues. Such warp-born phenomena can appear on the battlefield in an instant, and disappear just as quickly. All serve to obscure the Heretic Astartes from their terrified foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability. In addition, if your unit is a Nurgle unit, until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: No amount of bloodshed can truly satisfy this bitter champion’s desire for vengeance.
whenRules: Any phase, just after your focus of hatred is destroyed.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army (excluding Damned units).
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 12" of and visible to your unit. Until the start of your next Command phase, that enemy unit is considered to be your focus of hatred.

lore: Such embittered warriors as these shrug off hails of enemy fire with arrogant disdain.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Fearful of countenance, these ancient warriors are redolent with warp power and radiate a horrifying aura of might.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that is within Engagement Range of your focus of hatred.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Fights First ability.

lore: The Warmaster’s Black Crusade grinds ever onwards without restraint or remorse.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army (excluding Damned units).
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back, and bolt pistols, boltguns and combi-bolters equipped by models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability while your unit has not already inflicted 6 wounds this turn using that ability.

lore: No barricade or fortification is proof against the vengeful fury of these hate-fuelled murderers.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Tzeentch units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and change the Attacks characteristic of Torrent weapons equipped by models in your unit to 6.

lore: Thousands of years of ceaseless conflict have forged these warriors into skilled and merciless killers.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: These warriors employ expert saboteurs who utilise melta charges and improvised explosives to sow destruction.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy model with the Deadly Demise ability (excluding Titanic models) is destroyed.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army that was within 18" of that enemy model when it was destroyed.
effectRules: Your opponent does not roll to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by their model's Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted (if that ability inflicts a random number of mortal wounds, your opponent rolls to determine that number as normal).

lore: When the assault comes, it does so swiftly and without warning.
whenRules: Start of your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to Charge rolls made for your unit for each other Heretic Astartes unit from your army that made a Charge move this phase (to a maximum of +3).

lore: The Heretic Astartes are pitiless reavers, targeting weak points in the enemy line with ruthless efficiency.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll. If the target is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Some Heretic Astartes are masters of deceit, often feigning retreat only to open fire from close range.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Heretic Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: These warriors stalk their assigned target with dogged determination, reacting to their every move.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Employing fell techno-sorcery, the Heretic Astartes disrupt enemy navigational cogitators and scramble teleporter beacons.
whenRules: Start of the Reinforcements step of your opponent's Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units that are set up on the battlefield from Reserves cannot be set up within 12" horizontally of your unit.

lore: Such is their determination to claim their due that these warriors will gladly weather a storm of fire.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: If the bounty is to be claimed, the foe must first be purged.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within range of an objective marker, that attack has the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: Mobility is the key to victory. These Heretic Astartes raiders outmanoeuvre outflank the foe in order to achieve victory.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" or up to 12" if it is a Mounted unit. Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move if it disembarked from a Transport this turn.

lore: The engines of this vehicle or construct crackle with the row energies of the immaterium, propelling it forward at incredible speed.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Transport or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Utilising their swift transports, these ravagers plunge through the enemy lines to assault key positions.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or your Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn and has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if the target of that attack is within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: The prospect of riches spurs these renegade warriors forwards. Woe betide any in their path.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced. If you select one or more units within range of an objective marker as a target of that charge, add 1 to the Charge roll.

lore: Terror troops such as these inflict agonies upon their victims with malicious relish, targeting the weakened and wounded without pity.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Battle-shocked and/or Below Half-strength, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The violent and bloody slaughter of the enemy’s leadership hurls their followers into object panic.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a Heretic Astartes unit from your army destroys a Character unit.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes unit.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 12" of and visible to your unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: These predatory warriors sense weakness as the hydrashark smells blood, sating their bloodlust upon the fearful and wounded.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Battle-shocked and/or Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: These warriors strike in screaming waves, each charge as brutal as the last.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a tum in which it Fell Back.

lore: Jump pack borne warriors descend from the skies, terrifying screams emanating from their vax-grllles as they plummet towards their prey.
whenRules: Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, from the second battle round onwards.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army that is in Reserves.
effectRules: Set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units, but until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge. Then select one enemy Infantry or Mounted unit within 6" of and visible to your unit: that unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: The Heretic Astartes allow none to flee the battle, pursuing their broken foes with relentless savagery.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that Fell Back this turn and is within 6" of your unit. Your unit can declare a charge as if it were your Charge phase. When doing so, you can only select that enemy unit as the target of that charge (and only if it is an eligible target). Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

lore: These iron-willed warriors refuse to retreat, even in the face of overwhelming odds. Mounting losses serve only to drive them forward.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more attacks this phase and has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll, and if your unit is Below Half-strength you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: These implacable soldiers weather the enemy’s fury before striking back in kind, to devastating effect.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a melee attack is allocated to your unit, after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, roll one D6 (to a maximum of six D6 per attacking unit): for each 4+, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: These warriors focus their ire upon a wounded foe, combining fire to fell their target in a cavalcade of destructive force.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Even in the press of combat, the Heretic Astartes bring heavy weapons to bear, shattering fortifications and obliterating enemy infantry.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit's ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons) have the [PISTOL] ability.

lore: These warriors possess endless endurance and are capable of weathering untold hardships in order to destroy their foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: Veterans of countless grinding sieges, these Heretic Astartes repel and pin down wave after wave of foes with rapid boltgun fire and accurate artillery.
whenRules: Start of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit selects your unit as a target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).

lore: The eyes of the Dark Gods fall upon those who slaughter in their name.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army (excluding Damned, Daemon and Epic Hero units) destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character model in that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, add 1 to the Move, Toughness and Wounds characteristics of that Character model, and add 1 to the Attacks, Strength and Damage characteristics of that Character models melee weapons.

lore: The Blood God’s thirst can never be slaked.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if it is a Khorne unit: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Those Heretic Astartes sworn to the service of the Dark Gods display zeal through violence.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Chaos Undivided unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Those who offer praise to the God of Change may gain the benefits of his mutagenic powers.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to 3 lost wounds. In addition, if your unit is a Tzeentch unit below its Starting Strength, one destroyed model (excluding Character models) is returned to your unit with its full wounds remaining.

lore: As these warriors traverse the battlefield, an unnatural symphony of hypnotic music accompanies their every move, stupefying their enemies.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. If your unit is a Slaanesh unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

lore: A roiling storm of warp energy obscures the Heretic Astartes, leaving their foes shooting at indistinct shadows.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability. In addition, if your unit is a Nurgle unit, it can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: Within the massed ranks of a heretic cult, only a few are marked for greatness.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Desperate Pact. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll, and if your unit did not fail the resulting Leadership test when making that Desperate Pact, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: The zealous followers of the Dark Gods are devoted to the last. As death comes they strike a desperate final blow in hope of reward.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the attacking unit has resolved all of its attacks, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, roll one D6: on a 6, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound after all of its attacks have been resolved.

lore: Those in thrall to the Dark Gods will gladly sacrifice their lives to draw the eye of their darkling patrons.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Desperate Pact. If it does, your unit suffers D3 mortal wounds (in addition to any suffered for failing the resulting Leadership test), and until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of the melee weapons equipped by models in your unit, and if your unit did not fail the resulting Leadership test when making that Desperate Pact, until the end of the phase, improve the Strength characteristic of those weapons by 1 as well.

lore: Even in the grip of frothing madness, these heretics are murderous in the extreme.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Desperate Pact. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1, and if your unit did not fail the resulting Leadership test when making that Desperate Pact, improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.

lore: Consumed by a desire to spill blood, these fanatical heretics hurl themselves towards the foe.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Disciples of the Chaos Gods think nothing of sacrificing their lesser thralls to protect those of greater worth.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one friendly Damned unit within 3" of your unit and visible to both your unit and the attacking unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, while your Damned unit is on the battlefield, each time your opponent would make a Wound roll for an attack that targets your Heretic Astartes unit, if your Damned unit is visible to the attacking model and is an eligible target for that attack, no roll is made; instead, your Damned unit suffers a number of mortal wounds equal to the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: A daemon construct may beseech the Arkifane for further aid, adding to its soul debt in return for greater might.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Daemon Vehicle unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit invokes its contract, each time it makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: With each soul harvested the bound daemon comes closer to settling its contract and earning freedom.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Daemon Vehicle unit from your army (excluding Titanic units) that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit invokes its contract, each time it makes an attack that destroys an enemy model, roll one D6: on a 5+, your unit regains 1 lost wound after all of its attacks have been resolved (to a maximum of 6 wounds).

lore: Those steeped in techno-sorcery may trammel daemonic entities within mechanical constructs.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Vehicle unit from your army (excluding Daemon units).
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, your unit has the Daemon keyword.

lore: The tortured machine spirits of Heretic Astartes vehicles are driven forward by their anguish.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Vehicle unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

lore: Corrupted Heretic Astartes vehicles pursue their prey with an animalistic determination.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Vehicle unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6", but must end that move as close as possible to that enemy unit.

lore: The daemonic entities at the heart of possessed vehicles hunger for the life force of their enemies.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, when an enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Daemon Vehicle unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) that is within Engagement Range of your unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

lore: Bile’s experimental ministrations have left these warriors as freakish monsters. Cursed with clusters of compound eyes, distended, fang‑stuffed jaws or myriad other grotesqueries, they are hideous to behold.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Feeling the expectant gaze of Bile’s greatest creations from across the battlefield, transhuman and mortal warriors strive slavishly to impress.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, subtracting 1 from the result if it is a Damned unit: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The Clonefather’s agents are always searching for new test subjects. They strive to harvest the bodies of great leaders and champions, dragging them from battle and leaving the remaining foes utterly demoralised.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets a Character unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll. After your unit has fought, if one or more enemy Character models were destroyed as a result of those attacks, select one enemy unit within 6" of your unit. That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test. If the enemy Warlord was destroyed as a result of those attacks, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle‑shock test instead.

lore: Fabius Bile’s experiments are notoriously unstable. In the heat of battle, new mutations may burst forth in explosions of gristle and oozing gore, many of which are as lethal to the subject as they are to the enemy.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit (excluding Damned units) from your army.
effectRules: Your unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. Then select one augmentation (see Experimental Augmentations). Until the start of your next Command phase, models in your unit have the selected augmentation in addition to any other augmentations they have.

lore: Not even death can lay the most vile of Bile’s creations low.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit (excluding Damned units) from your army.
effectRules: One destroyed model (excluding Character models) is returned to your unit. If your unit is a Battleline unit, D3 destroyed models (excluding Character models) are returned to your unit instead.

lore: Arrays of subdermal vials inject autostimulants and biocatalysts into the warriors’ enhanced muscles, invigorating them for incredible feats of exertion.
whenRules: Start of your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Any phase, just after a HERETIC ASTARTES unit from your army has a mortal wound allocated to it.
targetRules: That HERETIC ASTARTES unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One HERETIC ASTARTES unit from your army within 9" of a HERETIC ASTARTES PSYKER, HERETIC ASTARTES DAEMON PRINCE or HERETIC ASTARTES DAEMON PRINCE WITH WINGS unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to D3+1 lost wounds. If your unit has the BATTLELINE keyword, you can return up to D3 destroyed models (excluding CHARACTER models) to your unit with their full wounds remaining, instead.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One HERETIC ASTARTES PSYKER unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one visible enemy unit within 12" of your unit. Roll one D6: on a 1, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 2-4, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 5-6, that enemy unit suffers 2D3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One HERETIC ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot that phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the IGNORES COVERS ability.

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One HERETIC ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to charge that phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Shooting phase.
targetRules: One HERETIC ASTARTES PSYKER, HERETIC ASTARTES DAEMON PRINCE or HERETIC ASTARTES DAEMON PRINCE WITH WINGS unit from your army.
effectRules:
Until the end of the phase, your unit has the following ability:

Shroud of Chaos (Aura): Models in friendly HERETIC ASTARTES units within 6" of this unit have the Stealth ability.

lore: Using augur beacons, servo-skulls and the like, the Ravenwing mark locations they have passed through and cleansed of foes, laying a trial their fellows can follow on the hunt.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One Ravenwing Mounted unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Be it their true quarry or simply one who possesses knowledge that will lead them to their apprehension, when the Ravenwing strike at a priority target they do so with unmerciful surety.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Ravenwing Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an Infantry Character or Mounted Character unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The Ravenwing employ shock tactics and focussed firepower to tear bloody paths through the enemy ranks, shattering resistance and clearing the way to their true quarry.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Ravenwing unit from your army that has just shot.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. That unit must take a Battle-shock test. When doing so, if one or more Ravenwing units from your army are within 6" of that enemy unit, subtract 1 from the test.

lore: Even when travelling at breakneck pace, the Ravenwing control their vehicles with consummate skill and are able to jink and dodge around incoming enemy fire.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Ravenwing unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: The Ravenwing scan and analyse their foes’ strategic dispositions constantly, augury and aerial surveillance helping to watch that no quarry slips their closing net. They are quick to redirect combat assets should such a risk present itself.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Ravenwing unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: With focused aggression, the Dark Angels relentlessly punish the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. In addition, if one or more Adeptus Astartes units from your army are currently Battle-shocked, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Even the Dark Angels must give ground occasionally, but their stubborn determination ensures they never do so for long, or without a fight.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: There is no escaping the wrath of the Unforgiven when they bring their disciplined firepower to bear.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT], [HEAVY] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

lore: Stern and vengeful as they are, the warriors of the Unforgiven Chapters deliver swift retribution to any foe foolish enough to try to lay them low.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that had one or more models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only the enemy unit that just attacked it, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: Countless assaults have faltered against the unbreakable ceramite wall that is the Unforgiven standing their ground.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The warriors of the Deathwing fight with the honed skill and lethality of knightly champions.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Deathwing Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If your unit is within range of your Vowed objective marker, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

lore: So driven by duty are the veterans of the Unforgiven that even death cannot keep them from it.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Deathwing unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 if your unit is within range of your Vowed objective marker. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The Deathwing employ ancient and incredibly powerful teleportariums, some older than the Great Crusade, to strike at their foes with unparalleled safety and accuracy.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Deathwing unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge.

lore: Channelling the strategic puissance and measured ferocity of their gene-sire, the veterans of the Unforgiven unleash a perfectly timed and utterly lethal storm of tightly controlled violence.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Deathwing Infantry unit from your army that just ended a Charge move.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit and roll one D6 for each model in your unit, adding 1 to the result if that enemy unit is within range of your Vowed objective marker: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 3 mortal wounds).

lore: In the name of their oaths to Chapter, Primarch and Emperor, the Deathwing march into the fiercest firestorms and refuse to falter.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Deathwing Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than your unit's Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: Engines roar, and teleportation flares erupt across the battlefield. Such is the din and ferocity of the Dark Angels’ assault that even the most veteran foes are given cause to cower before it.
whenRules: Command phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit. That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test. When doing so, if your unit has the Deathwing or Ravenwing keyword, subtract 1 from the result.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

lore: The belligerence of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Combining their specialised methods of warfare, the Ravenwing and Deathwing confound their enemies with high‑speed manoeuvrability and stalwart fortitude.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: If that enemy unit is within Engagement Range of one or more Ravenwing units from your army, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. If that enemy unit is within Engagement Range of one or more Deathwing units from your army, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of the target, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
restrictionRules: A unit cannot be targeted by this and the Armour of Contempt Stratagem in the same phase.

lore: Atop their snarling mechanical steeds, the warriors of the Ravenwing surge through seemingly impassable terrain, smashing through rubble and ruin to unleash the wrath of the Unforgiven upon unsuspecting targets.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Ravenwing unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features.

lore: Ravenwing vehicles tear across the battlefield, identifying priority threats and targeting them with volleys of killing fire. The storm of blazing fury serves as a beacon for the wrathful battle‑brothers of the Inner Circle, who strive to bring final judgement to the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase, just after a Ravenwing unit from your army has selected its targets.
targetRules: That Ravenwing unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 12" of your unit that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Deathwing unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The Dark Angels’ Inner Circle warriors pursue the Chapter’s sworn foes and any who shield them with relentless endurance and a determination borne of indoctrinated hatred.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One Deathwing Infantry or Deathwing Walker unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that only targets one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge.
restrictionRules: Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

whenRules: Any phase, just after your Oath of Moment target is destroyed.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 12" and visible to your unit. That enemy unit becomes your Oath of Moment target until the start of your next Command phase.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit. In addition, until the end of the turn, if your unit does not have the DEATHWING, RAVENWING or VEHICLE keyword, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced. If your unit has the RAVENWING keyword, it is also eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army within 3" of one or more enemy units, or one Deathwing unit from your army within 6" of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that only targets one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge.
restrictionRules: Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE or DEATH GUARD MONSTER model from your army with the Deadly Demise ability that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not roll one D6 to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your model's Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted. In addition, any enemy units that suffer mortal wounds as a result of this Stratagem are Afflicted until the start of your next turn.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Your DEATH GUARD WARLORD that is on the battlefield.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 3" to the Contagion Range of models from your army.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD model your army that has lost one or more wounds.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 3" of your model. Roll a number of D6 equal to the number of wounds your model has lost: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers one mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds) and your model regains 1 lost wound (to a maximum of 6 lost wounds).

whenRules: Start of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD CHARACTER unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit visible to your unit. Until the end of the phase, each time a DEATH GUARD unit from your army selects that enemy unit as the target of any ranged attacks, you can re-roll the dice to determine how many attacks a weapon equipped by a model in that unit makes.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an Afflicted unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: End of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one terrain feature within 24" of and visible to your unit. Until the start of your next turn, enemy units are Afflicted while they are within 3" of that terrain feature.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a visible enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT) within your opponent's deployment zone, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the ASSAULT ability.

whenRules: Your opponent's Command phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker visible to one or more models in your unit. Each Afflicted enemy unit within range of that objective marker must take a Battle-shock test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

whenRules: Start of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD VEHICLE unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit selects your unit as the target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD Attached unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD Attached unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD Attached unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Toughness characteristic of models in your unit.

whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD unit from your army that includes two CHARACTER models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Fights First ability.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, before the Reinforcements step.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD CHARACTER unit from your army that is not leading a unit.
effectRules: Select one other friendly DEATH GUARD unit (excluding Battle-shocked units and Attached units that already have two Leader units or one of your CHARACTER units leading it) within 2" horizontally and 5" vertically of your unit that your unit can lead (as described in the Leader section of its datasheet). Your unit attaches to that unit as a Leader. Change that unit's Starting Strength accordingly.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One BIOLOGUS PUTRIFIER unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit (excluding VEHICLES) that is within 8" of and visible to your unit. Until the start of your next turn, that unit has the effect of all Plagues (see Nurgle's Gift).

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One NURGLINGS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can target that unit with this Stratagem even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with its full wounds remaining.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more PLAGUE LEGIONS units from your army, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One PLAGUE LEGIONS unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units are not considered to be within Engagement Range of your unit for the purposes of selecting targets of ranged weapons. Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model loses a wound, while that model's unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6: on a 5+, your unit suffers 1 mortal wound after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One PLAGUE LEGIONS MONSTER unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One PLAGUE LEGIONS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, while an enemy unit is within 6" of your unit, that enemy unit is Afflicted.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, when an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One PLAGUE LEGIONS unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, while an enemy unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, each time that unit is selected to Fall Back, it must take a Leadership test. If that test is failed, that unit must Remain Stationary this phase instead.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One POXWALKERS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: After the attacking unit has fought, roll one D6 for each model from your unit that was destroyed as a result of those attacks: on a 6, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If your unit is not destroyed after the attacking unit has fought, enemy models destroyed as a result of this Stratagem count as enemy models destroyed by an attack made by a model in your unit for the purposes of the Curse of the Walking Pox ability.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One POXWALKERS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can target that unit with this Stratagem even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that made one or more attacks that targeted your unit this phase. Until the end of the battle, that enemy unit is Afflicted.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One POXWALKERS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, add 1 to the Move characteristic of models in your unit, and add 1 to the Attacks and Strength characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit.

whenRules: The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One POXWALKERS unit from your army that is in Strategic Reserves and that is not an Attached unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in that unit have the Deep Strike ability.

whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a DEATH GUARD unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That DEATH GUARD unit.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one friendly POXWALKERS unit within 3" of your unit and visible to both your unit and the attacking unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time you would allocate an attack to a model in your DEATH GUARD unit, if your POXWALKERS unit is visible to the attacking model and is an eligible target for that attack, no saving throw is made for that attack; instead a number of POXWALKERS from your POXWALKERS unit equal to the Damage characteristic of that attack are destroyed.

whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One TERMINATOR unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 3" to the Contagion Range of models in your unit.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One TERMINATOR unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One TERMINATOR unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One LORD OF VIRULENCE model from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker within 30" of and visible to your model. Until the start of your next turn, while an enemy unit is within range of that objective marker, that unit is Afflicted.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One TERMINATOR unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the ASSAULT and HEAVY abilities.

whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a TERMINATOR unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That TERMINATOR unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, then roll one D6 for each model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit: for each 2+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit. That unit must take a Battle‐shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in this unit makes a Pile‐in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding Blast weapons) have the PISTOL ability.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, re‐roll a Hit roll of 1. If that attack targets a unit within half range, you can re‐roll the Hit roll instead.

whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army makes a Charge move.
targetRules: That DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES). Roll one D6 for each model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that unit, adding 1 to the result if that model is not a CULTIST or POXWALKER model: for each 5+, the selected enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
