targetRules: One DEATH GUARD INFANTRY unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more friendly MYPHITIC BLIGHT‐HAULER units and that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: The spreading rust of the Ferric Blight can reduce armour of all kinds to nothing.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If the target of that attack is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control and a Critical Wound is scored for that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2 instead.

lore: Bleeding sores erupt all over enemies afflicted by the Sanguous Flux, the wounds never clotting or healing.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. While your unit is within range of an Infected objective marker you control, those weapons have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

lore: Those favoured by Nurgle are inured to pain, their rotting bodies shrugging off all but the most traumatic damage with ease.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Nurgle is a generous god, and through worship and devotion his followers can gain mighty rewards as they spread sickness in his name.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Death Guard model from your army.
effectRules: Your model regains up to D3 lost wounds. If your model’s unit is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control, your model regains up to 3 lost wounds instead.

lore: The strange lumps that form on victims of Boilblight – also known as Nurgle’s Fruit, Lumpen Splatter or the Crawling Pustulence – are easy to spot at a distance for the Death Guard.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Death Guard unit from your army, and one enemy unit within Contagion Range of that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a weapon equipped by a Death Guard model from your army targets that enemy unit, that weapon has the [HEAVY] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

lore: With a thrumming roar, a thick cloud of daemon flies whirls around the Death Guard and obscures them from the enemy’s sight.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability.

lore: The belligerency and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Only a truly versatile approach to warfare allows the tactical genius of the Deathwatch to best the myriad xenos foes they face.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army, or one other Adeptus Astartes unit your army.
effectRules: For each unit targeted, select the Furor Tactics, Malleus Tactics or Purgatus Tactics. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Mission Tactic is active for that unit instead of any Mission Tactic that is active for your army.

lore: Hellfire rounds douse their targets in voracious acids that are utterly lethal to organic life.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus Astartes unit from your army (excluding Vehicles) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons (excluding Devastating Wounds weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [ANTI-INFANTRY 2+] and [ANTI-MONSTER 5+] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Dragonfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Kraken rounds utilise adamantine cores and improved propellants to penetrate the thickest hide.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus Astartes unit from your army (excluding Vehicles) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of bolt weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 and improve the range characteristic of those weapons by 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Dragonfire Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Dragonfire rounds are designed to explode just before contact, saturating foes in cover with searing gas and flames.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus Astartes unit from your army (excluding Vehicles) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Site-to-site battlefield teleportation is a rare capability indeed, used only by the Deathwatch in extreme situations.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army, or one other Adeptus Astartes Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set each of those units up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: The belligerency and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Only a truly versatile approach to warfare allows the tactical genius of the Deathwatch to best the myriad xenos foes they face.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army, or one other Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: For each unit targeted, select Furor Tactics, Malleus Tactics or Purgatus Tactics. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Mission Tactic is active for that unit instead of any Mission Tactic that is active for your army.

lore: Hellfire rounds douse their targets in voracious acids that are utterly lethal to organic life.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Kill Team unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons (excluding Devastating Wounds weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [ANTI-INFANTRY 2+] and [ANTI-MONSTER 5+] abilities.

lore: Kraken rounds utilise adamantine cores and improved propellants to penetrate the thickest hide.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Kill Team unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of bolt weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 and improve the range characteristic of those weapons by 6".

lore: Dragonfire rounds are designed to explode just before contact, saturating foes in cover with searing gas and flames.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Kill Team unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

lore: Site-to-site battlefield teleportation is a rare capability indeed, used only by the Deathwatch in extreme situations.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Kill Team units from your army, or one other Adeptus Astartes Infantry unit from your army, if those units are not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. Until the end of your next Movement phase, models in those units that do not have the Deep Strike ability have the Deep Strike ability.

lore: Even the most bloodthirsty Drukhari will veil their enmity to work together against a shared enemy for the same gruesome purpose.
whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One Archon, one Succubus and one Haemonculus from your army.
effectRules: Discard one Pain token from your Pain token pool. Until the end of the phase, all three of those models’ units are Empowered.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem if you are able to select all three of the target models stated above.

lore: The hyper-fast reflexes of the Drukhari allow them to duck and weave to avoid all but the swiftest enemy strikes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Drukhari unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a Haemonculus Covens unit from your army for this Stratagem.

lore: The twisted creations of the Haemonculus Covens are insensible to all but the most mortal injuries.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Haemonculus Covens unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: The scent of a foe in pain draws Drukhari to it like hungry predators to an injured beast, their senses sharpening at its tang.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Kabal unit from your army and one enemy unit that is Below Half-strength.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: The Drukhari are masters at using hit-and-run tactics, engaging a target with a flurry of shots before quickly manoeuvring into cover or out of sight.
whenRules: End of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Drukhari unit from your army (excluding Aircraft).
effectRules: Your unit can immediately make a Normal move.
restrictionRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge and that unit cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move.

lore: Many Wych Cults favour spectacular gymnastic displays. Their fighters are never still, springing from one foot to the other at blinding speed.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Wych Cult unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even if it Fell Back or Advanced this turn.

lore: Wielding a horrifying array of hooked boarding blades, barbed lariats and other specialised tools of agony, these warriors hack and slash at their foes even as their transport skims low overhead.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a Drukhari Transport from your army has selected its targets.
targetRules: That Transport.
effectRules: After your Transport has fought, select one enemy unit that was the target of one or more of those attacks and roll one D6 for each model embarked within your Transport, adding 1 to the result if that embarked model is a Wracks model: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

lore: Employing smoke grenades, paralysing mists or simple cunning and agility, these warriors slip away like spectres.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Drukhari Infantry unit from your army that fought this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal or Fall Back move, but unless it is a Wyches unit, it must end that move wholly within 3" horizontally and 5” vertically of a friendly Drukhari Transport and must embark within that Transport at the end of that move.

lore: These warriors are well versed in raining suppressing fire on the foe even as they close with them from on high, shredding defences and leaving the survivors easy prey for the raid.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Drukhari unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [Sustained Hits 1] ability, or the [Sustained Hits 2] ability instead if it is a Kabalite Warriors unit.

lore: Employing smoke grenades, paralysing mists or simple cunning and agility, these warriors slip away like spectres.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Drukhari Infantry unit from your army disembarks from a Transport that made a Normal move this phase.
targetRules: That Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge.

lore: The crew of this skimmer delight in evading and taunting their enemies with mocking ease.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Drukhari Transport from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
effectRules: Your Transport can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: These powerful Drukhari devices occlude their raiding vehicles not only from physical sight but also targeting sensors and even psychic senses.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Drukhari Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: Jealous competition descends into frenzied carnage as the kill count climbs higher and the intoxicating screams of the dying fill the air.
whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One Drukhari or Harlequins unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1]. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability.

lore: These warriors are so absorbed by their desire to win the wager that they risk death to land their killing blows.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Drukhari or Harlequins unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if that unit is losing the wager: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: In bounding leaps and graceful pirouettes, the cavalcade of capricious killers bounds through hails of fire, cackling gleefully as they come.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Drukhari or Harlequins unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Having selected their victims, these killers strive to complete the kill with speed and brutality whilst moving ever closer to winning their macabre wager.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Drukhari or Harlequins unit from your army has Advanced.
targetRules: That unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Commorrite or Harlequin, these lithe combatants move with stunning speed, darting in and out of firing lines before their foes can raise their weapons.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase, just after a Drukhari or Harlequins unit from your army is selected to make a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, is set up on the battlefield, or declares a charge.
targetRules: That unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at your unit.

lore: The saedath’s victims become unwitting partners in a frantic dance of ghastly slaughter.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Drukhari Infantry or Harlequins Infantry unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". If your unit is currently losing the wager, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the SUSTAINED HITS 1 ability.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6"to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army (excluding BEASTS and VEHICLES) that is within 9"of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that is wholly within 9"of one or more battlefield edges and not within 3"horizontally of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Fight phase just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Fight phase, just before an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army Consolidates.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6"instead of up to 3",provided your unit ends that Consolidation move within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Command phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that made a Charge move in the previous turn and destroyed one or more enemy units in the previous Fight phase.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 6"of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if they are Below Half-strength. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit Falls Back.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army (you can only select a VEHICLE if it is a WALKER) that is within 6"of that enemy unit and would be eligible to declare a charge against that enemy unit if it were your Charge phase.
effectRules: Your unit can declare a charge. When doing so, you must select that enemy unit as a target of that charge, and your unit does not receive a Charge bonus this turn.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
effectRules: If your EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit is wholly within 6"of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army that has one or more TORMENTORS units embarked within it (excluding Battle-shocked units).
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your TRANSPORT is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through enemy models (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT that made a Normal move this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit is eligible to declare a charge.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit embarked within your TRANSPORT can disembark. When doing so, models in that unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6"of that TRANSPORT and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army, or up to two EMPEROR'S CHILDREN DEDICATED TRANSPORTS from your army.
effectRules: For each of those TRANSPORTS wholly within 9"of one or more battlefield edges, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit.
effectRules: Select one friendly LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit within 6"of your unit. One model in that LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit recovers up to 3 lost wounds or, if it is a DAEMONETTES unit, return up to D3+3 destroyed models to it instead.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: That LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit and one friendly EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit within 6"of it that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit can declare a charge. If it does so and it has already been selected to fight this phase, it cannot fight again this phase.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One SLAANESH BEASTS, SLAANESH INFANTRY or SLAANESH MOUNTED unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6"instead of up to 3". When doing so, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back, provided at least one of the targets of that charge is within Engagement Range of one or more EMPEROR'S CHILDREN units from your army.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One SLAANESH unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One DAEMONETTES unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. If it arrives back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere that is more than 6"horizontally away from all enemy units (instead of more than 9"). provided it is also set up wholly within 9"of one or more friendly EMPEROR'S CHILDREN units.

whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound or attack is allocated to a model in an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the following:that attack's Ballistic Skill or Weapon Skill characteristic; the Hit roll; the Wound roll.

whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement Range of your unit selects targets, it must select your unit as the target of its attacks.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit.
effectRules: Increase your pledge to Slaanesh by 1.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One or more EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER units from your army that have not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in those CHARACTER units have the SUSTAINED HITS 1 ability while targeting that enemy unit.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if your unit is your army's Favoured Champions. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit becomes your army's Favoured Champions, or just after your army's Favoured Champions unit destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: Your army's Favoured Champions unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that is not your army's Favoured Champions makes an attack, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit becomes your army's Favoured Champions.
targetRules: That EMPEROR'S CHILDREN unit.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 6"of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army. Until the end of the phase, each time your unit declares a charge, if that enemy unit is one of the targets of that charge, add 2 to the Charge roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One EMPEROR'S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: After the attacking unit has shot, your unit can make a Surge move. To do so, roll one D6:each model in your unit can move a distance in inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit. When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. If your unit is not your army's Favoured Champions, you can re-roll the dice to determine the distance of its Surge move.

lore: Broodkin are so fanatically loyal that they do not hesitate to sacrifice themselves to protect their leaders.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Character unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Character model in your unit would lose a wound, select one friendly Genestealer Cults unit within 3" of it (excluding Vehicle units). Your Character model does not lost that wound and that selected unit suffers one mortal wound instead.

lore: Flowing like a dark tide down hidden tunnels, along rubble-choked gulleys or through sagging and rusted vents, the faithful utterly encircle their enemies.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two Genestealer Cults units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Squirming, crawling and scrabbling through confined spaces is second nature to many broodkin, and is a skill they use to assail seemingly impregnable enemy positions.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: These Cultists have tracked their enemies tirelessly, as predatory beasts stalk their prey. Only when their position is perfect do they strike, engulfing their victims in a hail of unexpected firepower.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults unit from your army that arrived from Reserves this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Ballistic Skill and Armour Penetration characteristics of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

lore: In dark nooks and crevices the true believers of the cult whisper and skulk, all but invisible to those who approach.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability and can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12".

lore: Ever cunning and duplicitous, broods of the faithful often vanish back into tunnels and vents after their initial strike, ready to regroup and attack again elsewhere.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s turn.
targetRules: Up to two Genestealer Cults Battleline units from your army, or one other Genestealer Cults Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: The targeted units must have the Deep Strike ability and cannot be within Engagement Range of any enemy units when targeted.

lore: A tenet of guerrilla warfare is the concentration of even inferior firepower to inflict maximum harm.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two Genestealer Cults units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit (if this Stratagem is used in the Fight phase, that enemy unit must be within Engagement Range of both of your units). Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The broodkin have been trained and equipped for this moment, with weapons readied for Ascension.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults units from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

lore: The cult can expertly assail seemingly impregnable enemy positions.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: The brood lurks invisibly as the enemy approaches. Not until the last second do they burst from cover to strike.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Battleline unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when setting your unit up using a Cult Ambush marker, set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6" of that Cult Ambush marker and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: With their task of drawing the oppressors’ fire complete, the surviving cultists melt away, ready to strike again.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: An enemy’s fervour to strike down the faithful of the cult can be turned against them, luring the foe into a region laced with hidden traps and primed explosives.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit declares a charge.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Infantry unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: Roll one D6: on a 2-4, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 5+, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.

lore: Should one of the Patriarch’s inner coven fall, those that remain are swift to call for lethal retribution.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a Genestealer Cults Character model from your army.
targetRules: One other Genestealer Cults Character model from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Acolyte Hybrids, Hybrid Metamorphs or Neophyte Hybrids model makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the destroyed model was a Magus, Primus or Acolyte Iconward, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.

lore: The faithful will gladly hurl themselves into harm’s way, frenziedly dragging the foe down.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Acolyte Hybrids, Hybrid Metamorphs or Neophyte Hybrids unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Attacks and Weapon Skill characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models (excluding Characters) in your unit by 1 and those weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

lore: When the cult’s leaders demand devotion, danger and exhaustion are forgotten in the rush to serve.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Acolyte Hybrids, Hybrid Metamorphs or Neophyte Hybrids unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back. When doing so, if it targets an enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more friendly Character units, you can re-roll the Charge roll.

lore: Owing to their hypersensory reactions, the cult’s rate of fire increases.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Acolyte Hybrids, Hybrid Metamorphs or Neophyte Hybrids unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.

lore: Such is the creed’s inspirational call to arms that as the foe foil one incursion, another rises for the cause.
whenRules: End of the Reinforcements step of your opponent's Movement phase, if you have no Cult Ambush markers on the battlefield.
targetRules: One Acolyte Hybrids, Hybrid Metamorphs or Neophyte Hybrids unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
effectRules: This phase, you can set up your unit on the battlefield without using a Cult Ambush marker. When doing so, set up your unit anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units, not within your opponent's deployment zone, and wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.

lore: Bloody persecution by the oppressors is grist for the mill of the cult’s violent and zealous creed.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Acolyte Hybrids or Neophyte Hybrids unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a move of up to D6", but it unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding Aircraft). When doing so, models in your unit can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.

lore: Adaptive and intelligent, the purest of a cult’s broods can evade their foes to find new avenues of ingress.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers, before removing those markers from the battlefield.
targetRules: One Purestrain Genestealers unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
effectRules: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can move that Cult Ambush marker up to 6". If that marker is still within 9" of one or more enemy units, it is removed from the battlefield; otherwise, until the end of the battle, you can only select Purestrain Genestealers units from your army to be set up using that Cult Ambush marker.

lore: There are few more holy virtues in the cult’s eyes than to use one’s final act to lay low the oppressor.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a Genestealer Cults Character model from your army.
targetRules: That destroyed Character model. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. If that Character model is an Abominant or Patriarch, that enemy unit suffers 2D3 mortal wounds instead.

lore: The raw strength of those infused with the Patriarch’s distilled power is undeniable when directed against the foe’s hulking tools of tyranny.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Aberrants, Biophagus or Purestrain Genestealers unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Evidence of the bio-horror taint in their veins, the most blessed of a cult exhibit an inhuman swiftness.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Aberrants, Biophagus or Purestrain Genestealers unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". In addition, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends it as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.

lore: Triggered by xenos bio-stimms flooding their bodies, when the cult’s predators spring their trap, the jaws close inescapably.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Aberrants, Biophagus or Purestrain Genestealers unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit declares a charge, if the closest eligible enemy unit is selected as one of the targets of that charge, add 1 to the Charge roll for each selected target of that charge (including the closest eligible enemy unit), to a maximum of +3.

lore: Face to face with hideous genetic monstrosities, their full horror can shake even the most stoic soul.
whenRules: Start of your opponent's Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Aberrants, Biophagus or Purestrain Genestealers unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit within 9" of your unit is selected to shoot, it must take a Leadership test, subtracting 1 from the result. If that test is failed, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: With raw speed and subtle misdirection, Atalan Jackals outflank those who believe them trapped.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers.
targetRules: One Atalan Jackals unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
effectRules: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can set up that Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units and wholly within 6" of one or more battlefield edges. Until the end of the battle, you can only select Atalan Jackals units from your army to set up using that Cult Ambush marker.

lore: With evasive manoeuvres and split-second repairs, Outlander Claws marshal their rugged vehicles through the worst the foe can throw at them.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Goliath Rockgrinder or Goliath Truck unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: A cult’s experienced outriders are experts in hit-and-run attacks and close-range firefights. These skills are deadly when combined.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Mounted or Genestealer Cults Vehicle unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability while targeting an enemy unit within 18".

lore: An Outlander Claw’s skilled riders and crews can use their enhanced hybrid reactions to rapidly alter speed and course, roaring after fleeing prey or luring enemy out of position and leaving them flat-footed.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Achilles Ridgerunners or Atalan Jackals unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Serpent-fast, jinking and swerving with incredible skill, the cult’s light vehicles appear to slide through the oppressor’s gunfire.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Achilles Ridgerunners or Atalan Jackals unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: Skirting the edge of battle, an Outlander Claw’s raiders watch keenly for vulnerabilities, ready to throw themselves back into the fight to exploit any weaknesses in the enemy.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults Mounted or Genestealer Cults Vehicle unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Hulking armoured war engines provide ideal cover to launch a well-timed ambush.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can set up that Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units and wholly within 6" of your unit.

lore: Xeno-tainted soldiers have long learned to lurk in the shadows, ready to attack when the cult calls.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an Astra Militarum Infantry Regiment unit from your army (excluding Artillery and Character units) is destroyed.
targetRules: That Infantry unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Roll one D6: on a 3+, place one Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units (if this is not possible, no marker is placed) and add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Cult Ambush, at its Starting Strength, with all of its wounds remaining and any [ONE SHOT] weapons those models are equipped with considered as not having been shot.

lore: Disciplined salvoes of fire can drive the foe into cover, leaving them vulnerable to the rest of the cult.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase, just after an Astra Militarum unit from your army has shot.
targetRules: That Astra Militarum unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the turn, that enemy unit cannot be targeted with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem and each time a Genestealer Cults unit from your army selects that enemy unit as a target of a charge, you can re-roll the Charge roll.

lore: With martial pragmatism and the cult’s victory at stake, Brood Brothers will willingly open fire on the foe even if it endangers infiltrating cells of allies.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more Genestealer Cults units from your army. Until the end of the phase, your unit can make ranged attacks that target that enemy unit. If it does, after it has resolved those attacks, roll one D6 for each of those Genestealer Cults units: on a 5+, the unit being rolled for suffers D3+1 mortal wounds.

lore: As the Broodmind coordinates their timing, martial and insurrectionist comrades target their chosen victims in volleys of mutually supportive firepower.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum and one Genestealer Cults unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that is visible to both of those selected units and within range of at least one ranged weapon from each of those units. Until the end of the phase, models in those units can only make attacks that target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target). When doing so, each time such a model makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

lore: Forewarned of the enemy’s sudden onset by spies in their ranks or by the Brood Brothers’ own strategos, the cult’s faithful evade potential catastrophe.
whenRules: Reinforcements step of your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit is set up on the battlefield from Reserves.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum or Genestealer Cults unit from your army (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) within 12" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Goaded by the newly ascendant Hive Mind, the cultists fight with greater fury even as their muscles tear and organs rupture under the strain.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If one or more friendly Tyranids units are within 6" of that enemy unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.

lore: As the Tyranid invasion gathers pace, the influence of the Hive Mind surges like waves rolling ever higher onto a desolate shore.
whenRules: Start of any phase.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, increase the range of your unit’s Catalyst ability by 3".

lore: Some amongst the cult still retain enough sentience and zeal to feel rage and a need for vengeance if they see the Star Children slain.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.
targetRules: One Tyranids Character unit from your army that was destroyed by that enemy unit this phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a Genestealer Cults model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Cultists dash madly into the fighting without a care for their survival, drawn onward to aid the vanguard organisms by a will they cannot resist.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more Tyranids units from your army.

lore: Like predatory sea beasts lunging from wheeling shoals of fish, the vanguard organisms strike and fade from amidst the cultist hordes repeatedly, picking apart their overwhelmed prey.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: Never again will the tunnel networks of the cult provide secret roads for hopeful and idealistic freedom fighters. Yet they can still serve one last time as a means by which the Tyranids and their surviving worshippers can vanish from the battlefield only to strike again elsewhere.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Genestealer Cults or Tyranids unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Psychic fire rimes the blades of the Grey Knights as they charge at the foe, fanned by their battle fury. At the moment of contact, the empyric charge is unleashed in a blast of azure light.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Psyker unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit with the [PSYCHIC] ability also have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: Accessing a vision granted by the Chapter’s Prognosticars, the Grey Knights perceive the hidden ways of the battlefield and a sliver of the enemy’s intentions, granting them a prophetic situational awareness that aids their strategic disposition.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Psyker unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike or Teleport Assault abilities this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: Utilising their warp-attuned senses during the timeless instant of teleportation, Grey Knights know exactly where the enemy are before they arrive. They emerge from the blinding flare of warp energies already firing.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: Grey Knights Psyker unit from your army that either Advanced this turn or arrived using the Deep Strike or Teleport Assault abilities this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability and each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

lore: The blazing glare of ancient technology and the shrouding coils of the immaterium often linger, obscuring the Grey Knights’ presence.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Psyker unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike or Teleport Assault abilities this phase.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Movement phase, your unit cannot be targeted by ranged attacks unless the attacking model is within 12".

lore: When the enemy closes in, the Grey Knights wreathe themselves in psychic mists to confound the foe while they reposition until the time is ready to launch a counter-blow.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Psyker unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6" as if it were your Movement phase or, if it has the Deep Strike ability, it can be placed into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Grey Knights battle plate incorporates litanies of purity, strands of sanctified silver and other sacred wards, whose defences can be further empowered by ritual mantras.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Grey Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase and that is wholly within your army’s Hallowed Ground.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1, or, re‑roll the Wound roll instead if your unit is a Purifier Squad.

whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Purifier Squad unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 6" of your unit, adding 1 to the result if your unit includes Castellan Crowe: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Infantry unit (excluding Terminator units) that is arriving using the Deep Strike or Teleport Assault abilities this phase.
effectRules: Set up your unit wholly within your army’s Hallowed Ground and more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.

whenRules: Start of your opponent’s Movement phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit is set up or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 6" of your unit, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result if your unit is wholly within your army’s Hallowed Ground: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit that are wholly within your Hallowed Ground have a 4+ invulnerable save.

whenRules: Start of your opponent’s Charge phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit declares a charge and your unit is one of the targets of that charge, subtract 1 from the Charge roll, or subtract 2 instead if your unit is wholly within your army’s Hallowed Ground.

lore: When faced with their darkest hour, knightly Nobles rise to the challenge, for nothing shall deter them from fulfilling their duty.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights model from your army that has lost one or more wounds.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, improve your model’s Move, Toughness, Save, Leadership and Objective Control characteristics by 1 and each time your model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle. If your army is Honoured, you can use this Stratagem one additional time.

lore: The Noble brings their Knight suit’s full weight crashing down with the force of an industrial piledriver. Few can survive such a blow.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights model from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your model cannot target Monster or Vehicle units, but all melee weapons equipped by your model have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: Under the scrutiny and judgement of their Noble betters, Armiger pilots will redouble their efforts, attacking as one to smash aside their foes.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two or more Armiger models from your army and one enemy unit that is an eligible target for all of those Armiger models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of weapons equipped by those Armiger models by 1. If your army is Honoured, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of those weapons as well.

lore: Once a mighty foe is laid low, the victorious Knight’s emitters blare its triumph, announcing the glory brought to the Imperium, but shame awaits those who fail in such confrontations.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights model from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy Monster or Vehicle unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your model makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, add 1 to the Wound roll. If your model destroys that enemy unit this phase, you gain 1CP, but if your model does not destroy that enemy unit this phase, you cannot use this Stratagem again for the rest of the battle.

lore: Badly wounded, their Knight’s generator on the verge of overload, still the Noble fights on, drawing upon their reserves of chivalric heroism to sell their life as dearly as they can.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights model from your army that was just destroyed and that is eligible to fight but has not been selected to fight this phase. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Before rolling to see if this model deals any mortal wounds as a result of its Deadly Demise ability, it can fight; when doing so, it is assumed to have 1 wound remaining, or all its wounds remaining if your army is Honoured. After it has finished resolving its attacks, resolve its Deadly Demise ability as normal.
restrictionRules: You cannot target Sir Hekhtur with this Stratagem.

lore: Veteran Knight pilots can swiftly angle their ion shields to better deflect incoming fire.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights model from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, that Imperial Knights model has a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

lore: The Machine God’s worshippers brave storms of killing fire, trusting in the Omnissiah to shield them from harm.
whenRules: Any phase, just after a mortal wound is allocated to an Imperial Knights or Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army.
targetRules: That Imperial Knights or Adeptus Mechanicus unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: Those who dare to fell the Machine God’s creations find themselves subject to the vengeance of the Adeptus Mechanicus.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights unit from your army that was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, the enemy unit that destroyed your unit is Marked. Each time an Adeptus Mechanicus model from your army makes an attack that targets a Marked unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

lore: Tapping into the noospheric battle‑sphere, this Noble pilot issues binharic commands directly into the minds of Adeptus Mechanicus allies.
whenRules: Your Command phase, just before an Imperial Knights Character unit from your army uses a Bondsman ability.
targetRules: That Imperial Knights Character unit.
effectRules: When selecting targets for that use of that Bondsman ability, you can select one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus unit within 12" of your unit in addition, or instead of selecting one Armiger model. Until the start of your next Command phase, every model in that Adeptus Mechanicus unit is affected by that Bondsman ability.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a Knight Preceptor with this Stratagem.

lore: Soothing psalm programs inloaded by Tech‑Priests focus targeting arrays and enhance the responsiveness of the Noble pilot’s mighty Knight suit.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next turn, your unit can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: the Weapon Skill or Ballistic Skill characteristics of weapons equipped by its models; any Hit roll or Wound roll made for it.

lore: Driven by the wrathful whisperings of their Throne Mechanicum, the Noble pilot guides their Knight suit forward, weapons blazing with every step. Inspired by their titanic ally, the warriors of the Adeptus Mechanicus follow suit, pushing their cybernetic systems to the limit.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights unit from your army or one Imperial Knights Character unit from your army and one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus unit that is within 6" of that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your units have the [ASSAULT] ability.

lore: As augurs detect enemy movements, the pilot’s Throne Mechanicum comes alive with the whispered fury of their ancestors. Weapon systems flare instinctively to life, dispensing the hatred of long‑dead Nobles upon the unfortunate foe.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or ends a Normal, Advance, or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Imperial Knights Titanic unit from your army that is within 24" of and visible to that enemy unit.
effectRules: Select one ranged weapon equipped by a model in your unit. That model can shoot at that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target). When doing so, that model can only make attacks with that weapon and each time it makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers.

lore: The warriors of the Leagues of Votann pride themselves on their martial skill and proficiency in combat, and when the Ancestors are watching their actions they can quickly overwhelm and pick apart their foes.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army, and one enemy unit that has one or more Judgement tokens and is within Engagement Range of that Leagues of Votann unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 for each Judgement token that enemy unit has.

lore: Not for the Kin the sudden panic of the rout. Instead, they fall back steadily and by squads, laying down furious suppressing fire before launching fresh assaults.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Leagues of Votann unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Leagues of Votann unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge.

lore: Some foes are so loathed that the Ancestors themselves are said to pass sentence upon them, marking them for death.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets a unit that has one or more Judgement tokens, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

lore: Once an enemy target has been marked out by the Eye of the Ancestors, the Kin focus their efforts upon its destruction, redoubling their fury should it attempt to engage.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit that has one or more Judgement tokens has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your Leagues of Votann unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target the enemy unit that just attacked it, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: To strike down Kin is to earn the immediate and murderous ire of all their warrior comrades.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann Infantry or Leagues of Votann Mounted unit from your army that was reduced to Below Half-strength as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: The attacking unit gains 1 Judgement token, or up to 2 Judgement tokens instead if that Leagues of Votann unit contained your Warlord when it was targeted by those attacks.

lore: Void armour comprises hardened, jointed segments hooked into the void suit beneath. It is fashioned from magnaferrite weave, and often reinforced with adamantine and enhanced with microfield generators.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: These micro shield generators, worked into warrior jewellery or armour crests, trigger on command to provide short‑lived boosted protection.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Kâhl, Ûthar the Destined or Einhyr Hearthguard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: The single‑minded advance of the Kin rolls over collapsing enemy lines and exploits every fault and weakness, driving on towards the objective.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".

lore: Not only are the finest of the Kindred’s warriors selected for this duty, but they are also equipped with the best weaponry and wargear the Brôkhyr can produce.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Even should they be compelled to pull back momentarily, the warriors of the Hearthband maintain a punishing curtain of fire to erode the enemy further or rally swiftly and drive back into the fight.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Leagues of Votann Infantry unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Leagues of Votann Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: Built to a superior standard using secrets imparted by the Votann, the teleporters employed by this Hearthband can stabilise rematerialisation fields remarkably close to the foe.
whenRules: The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Leagues of Votann unit from your army that is in Reserves and has the Deep Strike ability.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, when your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.

lore: As though they unleash the raging flames of their kindred’s hearth upon the enemy, the Einhyr all but drown their enemies in fire.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Einhyr Hearthguard unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [RAPID FIRE 1] ability.

lore: Necron rulers possess sophisticated self-repair systems that can reknit their corporeal forms so they can once more command their legions.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Necrons Infantry Character model from your army that was just destroyed.
effectRules: Set your model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and more than 1" away from all enemy models, with half of its starting number of wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: Each model can only be targeted with this Stratagem once per battle.

lore: The Necrons strike with data-augmented accuracy, their murderous attacks as inescapable as the killing cold of space.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit. In addition, If a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

lore: At a hissing static signal, nanoscarabs are released in boiling black clouds that whirl about the legions and effect constant repairs.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit activates its Reanimation Protocols and reanimates D3 wounds. When doing so, if a Necrons Character is leading your unit, your unit reanimates D3+1 wounds instead.

lore: The legions employ the strategies of their masters in perfect synchronicity, laying down hails of mechanically coordinated fire.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within half of the firing weapon’s range, you can re-roll the Wound roll. If a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, this effect applies at the firing weapon’s full range instead.

lore: Arcing energies leap from one Necron unit to the next, lending speed to their limbs and causing their eye lenses to blaze.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability. In addition, if a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, you can re-roll Advance rolls made for your unit.

lore: In response to enemy attack, criss-cross fire leaps from the Necron ranks, forming a blazing corona of deadly energy from which there can be no escape.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a NECRONS unit from your army.
targetRules: One NECRONS CHARACTER unit from your army that was within 6" of that NECRONS unit when it was destroyed.
effectRules: After the attacking unit has resolved its attacks, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: Wreathed in tendrils of transdimensional shadow that intensify their deathly visages, these killing machines evoke such terror that steady aims tremble and blade arms are sapped of strength.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Through some quirk of their kind's shared insanity, a spark of gruesome satisfaction surges through them with every enemy life snuffed out, triggering quiescent power reserves that drive them onwards.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model from your unit makes an attack that targets a unit below Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll. If the target is Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well

lore: Through some quirk of their kind’s shared insanity, a spark of gruesome satisfaction surges through them with every enemy life snuffed out, triggering quiescent power reserves that drive them onwards.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has just destroyed an enemy unit, or just caused an enemy unit that was not Below Half-strength to become Below Half-strength.
effectRules: Your unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate.

lore: Driven into a state of hyperaggression, an Annihilation Legion’s most eager hunters plunge into their prey’s midst to maximise their butchery.
whenRules: Fight phase.
