targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".

lore: Whatever strange afflictions eat away at the sanity of Destroyers and Flayed Ones, mercy is not one of them.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that started the phase within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll one D6: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds. Your unit can then make a Normal move, but must end that move as close as possible to that enemy unit.

lore: To strike down one horror is merely to draw the rest of the pack’s insane and murderous focus.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed by the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move, but must end that move as close as possible to that enemy unit.

lore: Vindictive Crypteks often hardwire vengeance subprotocols into the ancient cores of their unliving servants, by which a last act of reprisal is assured.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.
targetRules: One Cryptek model from your army that was destroyed by one of the attacking unit's attacks. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Canoptek model makes an attack that targets the attacking unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Only the foolish tread where a Cryptek has set their sights, for these arcane scientists will suffer no threat to their works.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Cryptek or Canoptek unit from your army that is wholly within your army's Power Matrix.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: By remotely accessing a hidden engine’s most illuminating protocols, a Cryptek can release the awesome power of a caged solar flare.
whenRules: Start of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Cryptek model from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker within 18" of your Cryptek model.Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by friendly Necrons models have the [IGNORES COVER] ability while targeting units within range of that objective marker.

lore: Canoptek constructs spent the long Great Sleep in watchful vigilance. Triggering a surge of power, they are capable of responsive manoeuvres to outwit the swiftest of attackers.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Canoptek unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: With a twist to the fabric of time, a bubble of another moment enshrouds these constructs.Strange emissions from long - dead elder stars or utter darkness from a nighttime far in the future occludes them from their master’s foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Canoptek unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12".

lore: Canoptek constructs use sophisticated metalogic to craft sinister ambushes. Luring the foe in by appearing at suboptimal operation, a surge of reanimation protocols suddenly swells their numbers.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One Canoptek unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge and is wholly within your army's Power Matrix.
effectRules: Your unit's Reanimation Protocols activate.

lore: Obeying recall protocols, threatened tomb defenders will phase out of existence, only to be relocated to a more advantageous position by the tomb’s hulking Monoliths.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.
targetRules: One Necrons Infantry unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit's attacks and one friendly Monolith model.
effectRules: Remove your Infantry unit from the battlefield and then set it back up anywhere on the battlefield that is wholly within 6" of your Monolith model and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Necron quantum shielding is a true marvel of techno-arcana. Channelled with energy reserves from the rising tomb structures, the shielding is capable of adaptive remodulation to diffuse and deflect the most powerful enemy attacks.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Necrons Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: There is no rest for Necrons who fall in the service of their master. In dark crypts, their bodies are repaired and they are dispatched once more to war.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Your Necrons Warlord.
effectRules: For each of your Necrons units in Reserves, that Reserves unit's Reanimation Protocols activate.

lore: With a sanity-defying mechanism at the heart of the tomb, dynastic astromancers divine the pre-aligned point in space and time where a crucial role can be played in the wider battle plan.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army (excluding MONSTER units) that is arriving using the Deep Strike or Hyperphasing abilities this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: As the tomb’s warriors pass through a dimensional displacement corridor, the passage’s surface is lit with data-glyphs providing hyperlogical tactical information. When they step from an eternity gate, they are already prepared for the hunt.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army that was set up on the battlefield this turn using the Eternity Gate ability of a Monolith model that started the turn on the battlefield.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to charge this phase.

lore: Towering war engines rise from an erupting tomb in its defence, directing entropic energies to weaken and fracture the enemies’ own weapons and turning them into dangerous tools only the desperate would use.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Titanic model from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks and is within 18" of the attacking unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in the attacking unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

lore: With a pulse of necroneural energy that erodes the foe’s will, the Necron commander declares the fall of the enemy general, promising their remaining forces that it is only a matter of time until they join their master in ignoble death.
whenRules: Any phase, just after your opponent's Warlord is destroyed.
targetRules: Your Necrons Warlord.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time an enemy unit takes a Battle-shock or Leadership test, subtract 1 from the result.

lore: It is not only android soldiery that be compelled to serve. With a command, prized war engines and ornate weapons are empowered to hyperlethality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit from your army (excluding Titanic units) that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: A tomb world’s war engines are the pride of its nobility and they will suffer no affront to them, demanding the reassembly of slablike armour atom by atom even as the foe seek to sunder the vehicles.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Necrons Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Lychguard never tire, nor give a thought to their own safety over that of their master. With parrying blows and blocking shots they protect their liege even as they continue to strike down their opponents.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Lychguard or Triarch Praetorians unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Few enemy are worthy of a duel. What dangerous vermin are encountered are prioritised for execution to safeguard the nobles’ honour.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Lychguard or Triarch unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: The ancient and arrogant will of the nobility drives their powerful servants to stand their ground defiantly as they claim the dynasty’s rightful lands.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Lychguard or Triarch Praetorians unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit. If your unit has the Vehicle keyword, add 3 to the Objective Control characteristic instead.

lore: The Necrons are driven to reclaim what is theirs, exterminating all who would impede such efforts without mercy.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if the target of that attack is within range of one or more objective markers, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Wrought from living metal and further protected by the arcane technologies of Crypteks, the forms of Necron vehicles and steeds are almost impervious to conventional weapons.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Necrons Vehicle or Necrons Mounted unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets a model in your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: The time‑bending technologies in the nobility’s powerful vehicles allow them to traverse the battlefield in stuttering bursts of hypervelocity.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Necrons Vehicle or Necrons Mounted unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Using phase‑shifting technology, Necron war engines can slip into alternate dimensions, leaving only ghostly traces as they move through solid matter.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Necrons Vehicle or Necrons Mounted unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit can move horizontally through models and terrain features.

lore: Should the unclean thralls of lesser species threaten dynastic territories, the fallen Necron soldiery will rise to repel the interlopers.
whenRules: End of your Fight phase.
targetRules: One Necrons unit (excluding Titanic units) from your army that is within range of one or more objective markers you control.
effectRules: Your unit's Reanimation Protocols activate.

lore: Subroutines buried deep within the neural networks of Necron soldiers and crews enable them to react instantaneously to targeting locks, repositioning themselves to evade incoming fire or close in upon the foe.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One NECRONS unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that was the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6".

lore: Nobz load themselves with all manner of weapons in shows of wealth and influence, enabling them to smash the foe with a ceaseless barrage of attacks.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1. If a Waaagh! is active for your unit, you can re‑roll the Hit roll instead.

lore: With bone‑headed arrogance, Nobz will carry on killing before their deaths finally register.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not shot or fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result if a Waaagh! is active for your unit. On a 5+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can shoot or fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: As one enemy falls to the choppas of a battle‑hungry mob of Nobz, they immediately seek out more.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit is destroyed.
targetRules: One Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army that destroyed that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to D3+3" instead of up to 3". If a Waaagh! is active for your unit, it can move up to 6" instead.

lore: When a thundering mob of hulking Ork Nobz stampedes into the foe, their crushing momentum is a lethal weapon by itself.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That Nobz or Meganobz unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, then roll one D6 for each model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds). If a Waaagh! is active for your unit, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound for each 4+ instead.

lore: Furious with any snivelling gitz who attempt to back away from a good fight, Nobz will ruthlessly hack them apart as they turn to flee.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: When that enemy unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if a Waaagh! is active for your unit, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

lore: The sheer aggressive contempt advancing Nobz project, not to mention their thick skulls and ‘eavy armour, make them a terrifying prospect for foes desperately trying to gun them down.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Nobz or Meganobz unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Beast Snaggas have many tales of the times they took on the biggest prey, clobbering them with so many blows that what was left was a crumpled mass of broken hide and squished innards.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Beast Snagga unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets your Prey, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

lore: Smasha squigs are essentially battering rams on legs. Driven on by the squighogs piling in behind them, they plunge headlong into the foe, trampling one after the next.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Beast Snagga Mounted unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That Beast Snagga unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit and roll one D6 for each model in your unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds). If that enemy unit is your Prey, roll three additional D6.

lore: When bigger prey is sighted, nothing can keep a mob of Beast Snaggas from it. A great hunting chant erupts, and lesser gitz are swiftly forgotten in the enthusiastic impetus to pile into a bigger challenge.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Beast Snagga unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back, provided one of the targets of that charge is your Prey.

lore: Beast Snagga victims often make a break for it before the Orks have had their fill of fighting. With a roar, the Orks immediately give chase, or else lose interest and lunge after other potential trophies.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Beast Snagga Infantry or Beast Snagga Mounted unit from your army that was within Engagement Range of that enemy unit at the start of the phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: There is no hiding a Beast Snagga stampede, but the more agile amongst the hunters know how to evade the worst of an unsporting prey’s dakka.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Beast Snagga Infantry or Beast Snagga Mounted unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack targets your unit, models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack. In addition, if your unit has the Infantry keyword, until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Stealth ability.

lore: With a keen eye for tracking their prey, especially kunnin’ Beast Snaggas will circle round the hunt site to ambush the luckless gitz from another angle.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Beast Snagga unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy unit.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: The krews of a Mek’s stompiest contraptions revel in ripping apart anything they can get their klaws on, heedless of the damage done to their own gubbinz.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Orks Walker unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can choose to push it. Until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit and, if you chose to push it, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of those weapons and they have the [HAZARDOUS] ability as well.

lore: By pushing their engines past any sane level, Ork combat walkers can build terrifying momentum.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Orks Walker unit from your army has been selected to Advance.
targetRules: That Orks Walker unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, you can re‑roll Advance rolls made for your unit and ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.

lore: Stashes of extra speshul ammo provided by the Meks are often expended on rival monstrosities.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Mek, Orks Walker or Grots Vehicle unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can choose to push it. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle, add 1 to the Wound roll. If you chose to push it, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack and, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability as well.

lore: Orks have a tendency to hold the trigger down until their weapon stops firing, falls apart or misfires.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Orks Walker or Grots Vehicle unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can choose to push it. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1. If you chose to push it, you can re‑roll the Hit roll instead and, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability as well.

lore: A Gretchin’s lot is often a wretched one, and the spiteful zoggers will take any chance to cause pain and mischief using sneaky traps before legging it.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Gretchin unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units.
effectRules: Roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3+1 mortal wounds. Your unit can then make a Normal move.

lore: The Meks’ creations can afford to have all manner of useless junk blasted from them with little effect.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Orks Walker or Grots Vehicle unit from your army (excluding Titanic units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Galvanised by the rest of their mates fighting around them, Orks will redouble their efforts to outdo each other.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Boyz unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If your unit contains 10 or more models, re‑roll the Wound roll instead.

lore: In the massive fights that Orks enjoy, the only way to ensure a slice of the action is to bludgeon a path through the press to get a hand on the enemy.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Boyz unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase and is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit is selected to fight, when determining which models in your unit are eligible to fight, any models in your unit that are within 3" of one or more enemy models are eligible to fight. When resolving those attacks, such models can target one of those enemy units that is within 3" of them and within Engagement Range of their unit.

lore: With volleys of wagers, threats, insults, dung and the occasional hurled rock, mobs of Orks bolster each other’s spirits in the most Orky ways possible.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Two Boyz units from your army that are within 6" of each other.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, while those two units are within 6" of each other, they both count as containing 10 or more models for the purposea of your Detachment rule, any Enhancements models from your army have and any Stratagems you use.

lore: Orks are drawn to conflict and constantly race into battle at the merest hint of violence.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Boyz unit from your army.
effectRules: Return up to D3+2 destroyed models to your unit (excluding Character models).

lore: Once a horde of Orks get a sight of the foe, nothing can stop them.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Boyz unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit declares a charge, add 1 to the Charge roll and, if your unit contains 10 or more models, you can re-roll the Charge roll.

lore: Keeping Orks at arm’s length and pummelling them with as much firepower as possible is often the safest tactic for their victims. Unfortunately, it can also draw their attention and give them the urge to re‑educate the gitz in the joys of up‑close savagery.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Boyz unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: After the attacking unit has shot, your unit can make a Go Get ’Em! move. To do so, roll one D6: each model in your unit can move a distance in inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit. When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. If your unit contains 10 or more models, you can re-roll the D6 to determine how far your unit can move.

lore: Speed Freeks are often just blurs of vehicular mayhem that prove difficult to land a blow on.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Speed Freeks or Trukk unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 5+ invulnerable save. If your unit is a Vehicle unit with an unmodified Toughness characteristic of 8 or less, until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save instead.

lore: Speed Freeks live in their vehicles, so it’s no surprise to find small squigs lurking in some compartments. A few are vicious, and entertaining, enough to be worth lobbing into nearby enemies to cause anarchy.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Speed Freeks or Trukk unit from your army ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: That Speed Freeks or Trukk unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 9" of your unit. That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test and, when doing so, subtract 1 from the result.

lore: Often all an enemy will see of a Kult of Speed is a blur as they speed by, all guns blazing.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Speed Freeks unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. While targeting a unit within 9", they have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.
restrictionRules: A unit cannot be targeted by this and the Blitza Fire Stratagem in the same phase.

lore: Fiercely gripping the trigger, with a manic grin as they close on their foes, Speed Freeks fire so many rounds that some just have to find a weak spot.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Speed Freeks unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability and, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 9", a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.
restrictionRules: A unit cannot be targeted by this and the Dakkastorm Stratagem in the same phase.

lore: When racing buggies and warbikes charge at full pelt, the power behind their crews’ assault is so great that they can smash through the enemy.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Speed Freeks unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That Speed Freeks unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Sometimes new targets that emerge are just too juicy to ignore.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Speed Freeks unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: If their vehicle is on its last legs, any sensible Ork driver will aim its fiery remains into the nearest foe.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Orks Vehicle unit from your army with the Deadly Demise ability is destroyed.
targetRules: That destroyed Orks Vehicle unit, if you rolled a 6 for its Deadly Demise ability. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal or Fall Back move before its Deadly Demise ability is resolved, and before any embarked units perform an Emergency Disembarkation. When making this move, your unit can move over enemy units (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) as if they were not there.

lore: So resilient is Ork physiology – and so slow are Orks on the uptake – even death can take time to register
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: When Orks get stuck into the foe, the carnage is wonderful to behold, at least for all their mates.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Even the lowliest Ork Boy has a toughened hide and a dense skull. While there yet remains the prospect of a git to give a good kicking, it takes a blow of truly phenomenal strength to even give the Ork pause.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army (excluding Grots, Monster and Vehicle units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: The more Orks that gather in one place the more the Waaagh! energy flows, and the more fearless they all become.
whenRules: End of your Command phase.
targetRules: One Mob unit from your army that contains 10 or more models and is not Below Half‑strength.
effectRules: Select one friendly Battle‑shocked Orks Infantry unit within 6" of that Mob unit. That Orks Infantry unit is no longer Battle‑shocked.

lore: Even Orks can put on a surprising turn of speed when the promise of a good face‑to‑face fight is in the offing.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Orks Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, add 2 to Advance and Charge rolls made for your unit.

lore: If their vehicle is on its last legs, any Ork worth their steering wheel will aim its blazing remains into the nearest cluster of enemies. The ensuring explosions never fail to raise a rousing cheer from nearby Ork onlookers.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Orks Vehicle unit from your army with the Deadly Demise ability is destroyed.
targetRules: That destroyed Orks Vehicle unit, if you roll a 6 for its Deadly Demise ability. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal or Fall Back move before its Deadly Demise ability is resolved, and before any embarked units perform an Emergency Disembarkation. When making this move, your unit can move over enemy units (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) as if they were not there.

lore: So resilient is Ork physiology – and so slow are Orks on the uptake – that even killing wounds can take a while to register.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: When Orks get stuck into the foe, the carnage is wonderful to behold, at least for other Orks.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules:
One Orks unit from your army that has not been selected to fight
this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an Orks model in your unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Even the lowliest Ork Boy can take a tremendous amount of punishment before being slain.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a Vehicle or Gretchin unit for this Stratagem.

lore: The more Orks that gather in one place the more the Waaagh! energy flows, and the more fearless they all become.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Mob unit from your army that contains 10 or more models and is not Below Half-strength.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, while a friendly Orks Infantry unit is within 6" of that Mob unit, that Orks Infantry unit can still be selected as the target of your Stratagems even if it is Battle-shocked.

lore: Even lumbering Orks can put on a surprising turn of speed when the promise of a good face-to-face fight is in the offing. Once a horde of Orks get a sight of the foe, nothing can stop them.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Orks Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, add 2 to Advance and Charge rolls made for your unit.

lore: Some Orks, particularly those of the Blood Axe Clan, can resist their destructive urges long enough to prioritise the seizing of objectives.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the start of the next Command phase, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Some deviant Blood Axes go so far as to practise hand-to-hand combat, tailoring fighting styles to specific types of enemies.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Orks Infantry or Orks Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Select the [Sustained Hits 1] or [Lethal Hits] ability. Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability.

lore: Blood Axes feel no shame in retreating from a fight, particularly if the boss wants someone else duffed up.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Orks unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Orks unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: With their rocket packs at full throttle, Stormboyz plummet to smash into their foes with bone-crushing force.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Stormboyz unit from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That Stormboyz unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, then roll one D6 for each model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

lore: Seeing little value in pursuing fleeing foes, Blood Axe mobs turn their attention towards the next fight or press towards whatever cache of shiny gubbinz the boss desires.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit Falls Back.
targetRules: One Orks unit from your army that was within Engagement Range of that enemy unit at the start of the phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Utilising camouflage, cover or misdirection, these Orks slip away to prepare their next ambush, leaving their foes staring at thin air.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Kommandos or Stormboyz unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One ORKS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit, re‐roll a Wound roll of 1. If that enemy unit is within range of an objective marker, you can re‐roll the Wound roll instead.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ORKS unit (excluding GRETCHIN) from your army.
effectRules:
Until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your unit, even if you have already called a Waaagh! this battle.

Designer's Note: *This means that any abilities that are in effect while the Waaagh! is active for your army will be in effect for your unit.*

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ORKS WALKER unit (excluding KILLA KANS) from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, improve your unit's Move, Leadership and Objective Control characteristics by 1, and each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ORKS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the IGNORES COVER ability.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ORKS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible target within 18", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One ORKS unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Space Marines exemplify obdurate tenacity. Even injured, they will never abandon their oaths.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is below its Starting Strength.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and/or to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

lore: Once a foe is marked for destruction, the Angels of Death must not relent until the target is annihilated.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, and when making such an attack, if the attacking model is a VEHICLE, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Carefully cogitated binharic prayers can focus a machine spirit’s ire into near-obsessive hatred of its slayers, ensuring that vengeance is meted out even in death.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE model from your army with the Deadly Demise ability is destroyed.
targetRules: That ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE model. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not roll one D6 to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your model’s Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted.

lore: The heroes entombed within Dreadnoughts have fought across countless war zones throughout their extended existences, perfecting their martial prowess beyond mortal limits.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER model from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, improve your model’s Move, Toughness, Save, Leadership and Objective Control characteristics by 1 and each time your model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

lore: There are many tales of machine spirits wreaking havoc on the foe, even after the crew of their vehicle are slain and critical systems are failing.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE unit from your army that was reduced to Below Half-strength as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: Every Chapter has forged its own tales of heroism, and none of its battle-brothers would see that noble record besmirched.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] ability. If your unit is under the effects of the Assault Doctrine, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of such weapons by 1 as well.

lore: Imminent death does not prevent a Space Marine from enacting his final justice upon the enemies of the Imperium.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: There is no escaping the wrath of the Space Marines, and they use their weapons to bring swift death to their foes wherever they may hide, expertly placing their shots to wreak maximum damage.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability. If your unit is under the effects of the Devastator Doctrine, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of such weapons by 1 as well.

lore: The tenets of the Codex Astartes allow for unorthodox use of combat tactics and the employment of divergent strategic doctrines if doing so will lead to victory.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Devastator Doctrine, Tactical Doctrine or Assault Doctrine. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Combat Doctrine is active for that unit instead of any other Combat Doctrine that is active for your army, even if you have already selected that doctrine this battle.

lore: Space Marines know precisely when to give ground in order to leave their enemies floundering, before surging back into the fight and driving them from the field in disarray.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry or Adeptus Astartes Mounted unit from your army that is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or a Normal move of up to 6" instead if it is under the effects of the Tactical Doctrine.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Cleaving to duty, the Adeptus Astartes refuse to be drawn out of position. Instead they secure ground to establish new fire lines to the enemy.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can immediately make a Fall Back move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: When making that move, your unit must end that move either wholly within your deployment zone or within range of an objective marker.

lore: Siege warfare is incomparably brutal. Space Marines battle with the fiercest determination to achieve victory, and will fight unto death to hold every defensive line or to secure gains they have wrested from the enemy.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army within range of an objective marker.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, double the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit, but it must Remain Stationary this turn.

lore: To combat an entrenched force of Space Marines, foes resort to armoured vehicles or packs of murderous monstrosities. Even the greatest of behemoths has a chink in its armour and the Adeptus Astartes are well versed in exploiting such weaknesses.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Space Marines train for countless hours to master their weapons and in the heat of battle can trigger mnemonic patterning to recall their ritual drills and ensure the foe’s destruction.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If your unit Remained Stationary this turn, then until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Space Marines' incredible battlefield awareness enables them to instinctively identify the origin of any enemy fire and punish their attackers.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Only where the enemy can be faced eye to eye can a Space Marine be truly tested.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest eligible target within 6", add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: No time can be wasted in punishing the Emperor's foes. Many are those that deserve death and once one enemy is vanquished, soon must another follow.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TRANSPORT unit from your army that has no models embarked within it, and one ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT.
effectRules: Your INFANTRY unit can embark within that TRANSPORT.
restrictionRules: You cannot target an INFANTRY unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, that cannot normally embark within that TRANSPORT, or that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.

lore: Salvo after salvo of burning promethium unleashed in synchronised waves will leave almost any foe as smouldering ash.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Torrent weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: Armed with targeting data supplied by their transport's augury gheists, warriors erupt from the assault ramps with weapons blazing in ruthless eradication patterns.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible target within 12", add 1 to the Hit roll. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as the result of any of those attacks, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model’s unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: To open fire on warriors of a Firestorm Assault Force is merely to invite one’s own swift destruction.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TRANSPORT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: One unit embarked within that TRANSPORT can disembark as if it were your Movement phase, and can then shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Warriors of Stormlance Task Forces can suddenly pour heavy and accurate fire into the enemy even as they race to finish off any survivors.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability. If such a weapon already has this ability, until the end of the phase, that weapon has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability as well.

lore: On the eve of riding down the most elusive prey, the task force's expert Techmarines will entreat the engine spirits o f their vehicles, honing the iron steeds' performance to elicit even more speed from them.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED or ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE unit (excluding WALKERS) from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit, or 9" instead if your unit is MOUNTED.

lore: The Adeptus Astartes are elite troops who strike with all the speed and fury of a searing thunderbolt.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, you can re-roll Charge rolls made for your unit and melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LANCE] ability.

lore: Like zephyrs dancing across wide horizons, Space Marine riders and pilots can weave lithely around incoming fire with incredible skill.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED or ADEPTUS ASTARTES FLY VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll and subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: Space Marines are loathe to be brought into combat on any others’ terms, especially the warriors of Stormlance Task Forces, whose battlefield tactics revolve around speed and precise, ferocious assaults.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Warriors of a Vanguard Spearhead will rig critical objectives with explosives to deny them to the enemy.
whenRules: Start of the Command phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES MOUNTED unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is said to be Sabotaged, and remains under your control even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. While an objective marker is Sabotaged and under your control, each time an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move within range of that objective marker, roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Every tyrant must fear the assassin's blade, and the vanguard spring ambushes with precision coordination.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: To evade one’s enemies and sow confusion can be a deadly weapon in itself.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit that is more than 12" away, improve the Ballistic Skill and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1. If one or more enemy models are destroyed as a result of those attacks, select one of those destroyed models; that destroyed model’s unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: A feigned retreat can be used to overextend eager foes or draw them into deadly arcs of fire.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit declares a charge.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or up to 6" instead if it is a PHOBOS or SCOUT SQUAD unit.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: At the opportune moment, Space Marine infiltration units slip away from battle, only to relocate ready to strike the foe again.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two PHOBOS and/or SCOUT SQUAD units from your army, or one other ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: Each unit selected for this Stratagem must be more than 3" away from all enemy models.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: When the fighting is at its fiercest, the veteran warriors of the Chapter truly show their quality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. If your unit is Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

lore: The 1st Company's veterans unleash their skills with an efficiency that is harrowing to witness.
whenRules: Your Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
effectRules: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

lore: Adeptus Astartes veterans claim critical objectives in daring strikes, annihilating resistance in their Chapter’s name before sweeping onto their next target.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: Teleportarium chambers within orbiting strike cruisers are able to perform site-to-strike teleportations for Terminator-armoured battle-brothers in extremis.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. It will arrive back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Many are the legendary tales of the 1st Company holding their ground against the odds, weathering assaults that would have swept away lesser warriors.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a charge move.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR, BLADEGUARD VETERAN SQUAD, STERNGUARD VETERAN SQUAD or VANGUARD VETERAN SQUAD unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the Librarian alters his foes’ perceptions.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Psyker unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that is within 18" of and visible to one Psyker model in your unit. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is pinned. While a unit is pinned, subtract 2 from that unit’s Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. In addition, if the Telepathy Discipline is active for your army, that enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes, combined with their transhuman physiology, makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: As the enemy closes in for the kill, the psyker manifests his psychic will in a raging inferno that obscures imperilled allies and threatens to immolate any who come close enough to land a blow upon them.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: This Librarian lends skull‑shattering weight and impact to melee strikes by transmuting flesh into unyielding metal.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry unit from your army that is within 18" of one or more Adeptus Astartes Psyker models from your army and has not been selected to Fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit, or add 2 if the Biomancy Discipline is active for your army.

lore: Using nothing but the power of his mind, a Librarian can rip rubble, boulders and other debris from the surrounding terrain and hurl them at the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Psyker unit from your army that is eligible to shoot.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to one or more Psyker models in your unit (excluding units with the Lone Operative ability), and roll six D6, adding 1 to each result if the Telekinesis Discipline is active for your army: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: Sharing some of his prescience with his battle‑brothers, a Librarian can guide their fire.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability, and the [IGNORES COVER] ability as well if the Divination Discipline is active for your army.

lore: The belligerency and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets a model in your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: With the scent of blood in the air and the rushing joy of battle surging through every true warrior’s hearts, even the greatest quarry can be brought down.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1. If the Saga of the Beastslayer has been completed by your army, until the end of the phase, such weapons have the [LANCE] ability as well.

lore: Imbued as they are with the cunning psychic might of the Rune Priests, shamanistic totems, tattoos and fetishes are a potent shield against baleful attacks and the foul sorcery of witches.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds and Psychic Attacks. If the Saga of the Bear has been completed by your army, until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds and Psychic Attacks instead.

lore: Having stalked their prey or run them to ground, all that remains is to go for the enemy’s weakest points, to rip them apart in a furious bloodletting. Onlookers are stricken with terror at the bloody spectacle, an instant before the sons of Russ pounce upon them.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move in Unit Coherency and within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units. In addition, if the Saga of Majesty has been completed by your army, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit when it ends that Consolidation move must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: The greatest champions amongst the sons of Russ must take the fight to the enemy, leading by example to uphold the honour of their Chapter.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character model from your army.
effectRules: Select one Saga that has not yet been completed by your army. Until the end of the turn, models in your Character’s unit have the benefit of the selected Saga as if it had been completed by your army.

lore: Once their blades and claws run red with the enemy’s blood, nothing will hold the savage sons of Russ back from new prey.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army makes a Fall Back or Advance move.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot even though it Fell Back or Advanced this phase. If the Saga of the Warrior Born has been completed by your army, until the end of the turn, your unit is also eligible to declare a charge.

lore: Long and bloody experience has taught these warriors how best to identify the slightest weakness in their prey and exploit it to the fullest.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] abilities. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have that ability.

lore: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: A few quick cuts with a diamond‑keen hunting knife or energised claw tip leave Fenrisian runes carved into bedrock, plasteel or flesh, marks of abjuration against the foe and secret messages between Space Wolves alike.
whenRules: End of your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry or Adeptus Astartes Walker unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

lore: Raising their feral voices as one, the elite champions of Fenris give voice to a predatory howl fit to freeze the marrow of the bravest warriors.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Terminator unit from your army.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if that unit is Below Half‑strength.

lore: These veteran warriors approach the foe like wolves on the hunt. They are ever‑poised to drop into cover or fade into the shadows to avoid their prey’s increasing desperation to drive them off.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Stealth ability.

lore: A Fenrisian gunship skims low over the battlefield, touching down just long enough for these elite warriors to embark before it lifts off again. The enemy’s respite will not last long; it will return with its deadly cargo soon enough.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Terminator unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". When doing so, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit is destroyed by an ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
targetRules: That ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit.
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit, or one SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a SPACE WOLVES unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That SPACE WOLVES unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army (excluding BEASTS) that have not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit visible to both of your units. Until the end of the phase, models in your units can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and each time a model in one of your units makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the LETHAL HITS ability.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re‑roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Wolf Guard Headtaker or Wolf Guard Terminator Pack Leader model from your army.
effectRules:
Until the start of your next Command phase, your model has the CHARACTER keyword.

Designer's Note: *While in effect, your model's unit is therefore a* CHARACTER *unit, meaning it can interact with the Heroes All rule (see Detachment Rules section), in addition to other rules that interact with* CHARACTER *units.*

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that targets only one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase. Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models) and sections of terrain features that are 4" or less in height. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
