effectRules: Until the end of the phase, after your unit has shot, select one enemy CHARACTER, MONSTER, or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that unit is pinned. While a unit is pinned, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". If your unit has the SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY keywords, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WULFEN INFANTRY or BLOOD CLAWS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, after that enemy unit has shot, if one or more models in your unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, your unit can make an Impetuous move. To do so, roll one D6: your unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

lore: This system injects the battlesuit pilot with a measured dose of chemical stimulants intended to temporarily accelerate their physical aptitude and pain tolerances.
whenRules: Fight phase or your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One T’au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

lore: T’au are experts at harrying and outmanoeuvring their foes, bleeding them with accurate fire before fading away into the shadows and luring the foe into a trap.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T’au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that can Fly whose attacks have been resolved this phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn.

lore: T’au combined arms groups are called Hunter Cadres for good reason. Working in close coordination, they hunt and destroy the most dangerous enemy targets.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T’au Empire unit from your army that has just been selected as an Observer unit (see For the Greater Good).
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets their Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if your unit has the Markerlight keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

lore: The Kauyon teaches to lure the enemy into deadly point-blank ambushes.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T’au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

lore: Hurling a volley of photon grenades, the T’au leave their enemies dazzled and disorientated, unable to close the distance into combat at a crucial moment.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One T’au Empire Grenades unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge.
effectRules: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test, and until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

lore: Those who act as the lure in the Kauyon must be ready to make a hasty withdrawal once the enemy closes into killing range, lest they be trapped.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One T’au Empire Infantry unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge, and one friendly Transport.
effectRules: Your unit can embark within that Transport. If it does, your opponent can select new targets for that charge.
restrictionRules: Every model in your T’au Empire Infantry unit must be within 3" of that Transport and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

lore: Kauyon teaches that many things can be used to bait a trap, luring the foe into position.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase. The first time you use this Stratagem, you must also select one objective marker that is not in your opponent's deployment zone; until the end of the battle, this becomes your Trap objective marker.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Trap objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

lore: Devastating firepower need not be applied from afar, especially when striking an unsuspecting foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

lore: T’au Hunter Cadres work in close coordination to destroy the most dangerous enemy targets.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has just been selected as an Observer unit (see For the Greater Good).
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets their Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if your unit has the Markerlight keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

lore: Those who act as the lure in the Kauyon must be ready to make a hasty withdrawal once the enemy closes into range.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Infantry unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge, and one friendly Transport.
effectRules: Your unit embarks within that Transport.
restrictionRules: Every model in your Infantry unit must be within 3" of that Transport and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

lore: Hurling a volley of photon grenades, the T’au leave their enemies dazzled and disorientated.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Grenades unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge.
effectRules: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test, and until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: T’au Stealth Cadres utilise obfuscation fields and wide-band refraction beams to mask their advance.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Stealth, Ghostkeel or Commander Shadowsun unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Mont’ka emphasises rapid evolving threat-analysis and the application of overwhelming firepower to eliminate emergent high-priority targets.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit (excluding Kroot units) from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a T'au Empire unit (excluding Kroot units) from your army makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

lore: By advancing swiftly into commanding positions, Mont’ka forces maximise the benefits of their enemies’ shock and disorientation.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Mont’ka doctrine heavily emphasises the massed concentration of fire upon a single target at a time, obliterating each component of the enemy force in succession with a series of unrelenting barrages.
whenRules: Start of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: Two T'au Empire units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic by 1.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem during the fourth or fifth battle rounds.

lore: The most aggressive Fire caste warriors sometimes spring from moving transports, roll with the impact of landing, and come up with weapons already blazing.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Infantry unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Rather than charge into hand-to-hand combat, T’au soldiery instead intensify their fire patterns, pinning their advancing foes and staving off their onslaught.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Infantry unit (excluding Kroot units) from your army that has just shot, and one enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) hit by one or more of those attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, that enemy unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2 from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

lore: Point-defence systems trigger as incoming fire is detected, blasting projectiles from the air and lessening the power of the enemy fusillade.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: Devices are incorporated into some battlesuits either to prevent high-ranking pilots being taken alive for interrogation or to prevent just such fatal explosions.
whenRules: Any phase, just after a T'au Empire Battlesuit model from your army is destroyed.
targetRules: That destroyed model's unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.
effectRules: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

lore: On-board hypodermics shunt pain-blockers and chemical stimulants into the pilot’s system.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

lore: Made famous by Commander Farsight and his protégé Brightsword, this philosophy encourages pilots to drop into the very teeth of the enemy army and apply their firepower at point-blank range.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Battlesuit unit from your  army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: Commander Arro’kon’s teachings are considered pre-eminent in the art of engaging and eliminating numerically overwhelming enemy formations.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

lore: Though now disgraced by association with O’Shovah, Sub-Commander Torchstar’s strike-and-fade tactics are still taught – albeit officially under other names – in many Fire caste academies.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that can Fly whose attacks have been resolved this phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn.

lore: First used by O’Jir during the battle for Laguna Shard, these battlesuit-mounted emitters batter advancing foes backwards with gravitic pulse waves.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One T'au Empire Battlesuit unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: When a Kroot Hunting Pack closes in on its prey, there are often other hunters waiting to join in the fray and take their share of any spoils.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Kroot Infantry or Kroot Hounds unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed Character units to Attached units.

lore: The Kroot have long perfected the art of ambush hunting, their packs working in deadly concert.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Kroot unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: After your unit has resolved its attacks this phase, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a Kroot model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Furnished by T’au allies or returning Farstalkers, these electromagnetic grenades wreak havoc with the animuses of armoured fighting vehicles.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy Vehicle unit is selected to shoot or fight.
targetRules: One Kroot Grenades unit from your army within 8" of that enemy Vehicle unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, worsen the Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill characteristics of that enemy Vehicle unit's weapons by 1.

lore: The psychological impact of witnessing one’s comrades being dismembered and devoured by gore-splattered Kroot cannot be overstated.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Kroot unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
effectRules: In your opponent's next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

lore: Kroot see no value in stand-up fights, caring little for honour or glory. They hit and fade, frustrating their foes and bleeding them by degrees until – weakened and out of position – they are rendered vulnerable.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Kroot unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Kroot unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge.

lore: The Kroot are experts in camouflage and concealment, able to utilise cover in ways most foes would never consider and – to their great misfortune – do not anticipate.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Kroot unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12".

lore: These experimental Earth caste weapon upgrades can only activate for short bursts at a time, but the extra stopping power they provide is formidable.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

lore: Target analysis data from scanning drones is rapidly translated into inputs ideally tailored to a range of alien sensoria and then disseminated through the cadre.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If it is a Kroot or Vespid Stingwings unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.

lore: Regular Fire caste forces operating as part of auxiliary cadres are well trained in swift repositioning and fighting retreats, the better to exploit the presence of or provide support for their alien comrades.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move if it disembarked from a Transport this turn.

lore: Air caste craft have dropped drones that emit pheromones into this region, their emissions invisible but blazing like beacons to the correct alien senses.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Kroot or Vespid Stingwings unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: There is much that the alien auxiliaries of the T'au empire can teach the Fire caste, not least through practical and deadly battlefield demonstrations.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced. If it is a Kroot or Vespid Stingwings unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced as well.

lore: These Fire Warriors employ sensory data fed to them by supporting alien auxiliary units to maximise accuracy and place their shots against weak points they might not have perceived.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'au Empire unit from your army (excluding Kroot and Vespid Stingwings units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit. If your unit is wholly within 9" of one or more Kroot or Vespid Stingwings units from your army, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit instead.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one BATTLESUIT model in your unit: that model regains up to D3+1 lost wounds.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time you roll one or more dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in your unit, you can re‐roll the result.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules:
Select one of the following to apply to your unit until the end of the phase:

• Improve the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.
• Improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1, and those weapons have the HAZARDOUS ability.
restrictionRules: You cannot target the same unit with the Experimental Ammunition and Threat Assessment Analyser Stratagems in the same phase.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Select the SUSTAINED HITS 1 or LETHAL HITS ability. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability. You can instead select the SUSTAINED HITS 1, LETHAL HITS and HAZARDOUS abilities to apply to those weapons until the end of the phase.
restrictionRules: You cannot target the same unit with the Experimental Ammunition and Threat Assessment Analyser Stratagems in the same phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One T'AU EMPIRE CRISIS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: To pit one’s own psychic prowess against the sorcerous might of the Thousand Sons is to be trapped, helpless and screaming, within one’s own mind.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Thousand Sons unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all attacks made against your unit with Psychic weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability and all models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic Attacks.

lore: The Architect of Fate has great designs for his pawns, which do not include their untimely demise just yet...
whenRules: Any phase, when a saving throw is failed for a Thousand Sons Psyker model from your army.
targetRules: That Psyker model.
effectRules: Change the Damage characteristic of that attack to 0.

lore: This warrior’s veins burn with raw sorcery. The sheer unstoppable might of their conjurations is such that, when unleashed with destructive intent, there is little that can prevent them from devastating manifestation.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Psychic Attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Utilising the fell powers of the warp, Thousand Sons Sorcerers infuse their minions’ bolter rounds with empyric energies to render them even deadlier.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all inferno bolt pistols, inferno boltguns, inferno combi-bolters and inferno combi-weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PSYCHIC] ability and a Strength characteristic of 5.

lore: The most powerful sorcerers of the Thousand Sons are battle-psykers who can, if the need is dire enough, siphon a sliver of their corrupted souls into their eldritch assaults to temporarily boost their potency.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 9" to the range of Psychic weapons equipped by your unit.

lore: With their tainted souls melded as one in the warp, what one champion of the cabal sees, all their fellows see also.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army and one enemy unit that is visible to that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Thousand Sons Psyker model makes an attack with a Psychic weapon that targets that enemy unit, that attack has the [INDIRECT FIRE] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control, if that objective marker is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if your unit is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot or declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. If your unit is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic when it is targeted with this Stratagem, then until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Start of the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One RUBRIC MARINES or SCARAB OCCULT TERMINATORS unit from your army that is in Strategic Reserves.
effectRules: If it is a RUBRIC MARINES unit, until the end of the phase, it has the Deep Strike ability. When your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, if it is a SCARAB OCCULT TERMINATOR unit it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic and more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: If a SCARAB OCCULT TERMINATORS unit is targeted with this Stratagem, it is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase and is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the IGNORES COVER ability. After your unit has shot this phase, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, models in that unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability, and, if your unit is wholly within your army's Flow of Magic, each time an attack targets your unit, it has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS CHARACTER model from your army (excluding MONSTERS) that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: At the end of the phase, add one TZEENTCH CHAOS SPAWN unit containing one model to your army, and set it up as close as possible to where your model was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One TZAANGORS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a TZEENTCH MUTANT unit from your army is selected to fi ght.
targetRules: That TZEENTCH MUTANT unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", and when determining which models in it are eligible to fight, any models in it that are within 3" of one or more enemy models are eligible to fight. When resolving those attacks, such models can target one of those enemy units that is within 3" of them and within Engagement Range of their unit.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER model from your army, and one friendly TZAANGORS unit that is below its Starting Strength and within 12" of that PSYKER model.
effectRules: Return up to D3+1 destroyed models (excluding CHARACTERS) to your TZAANGORS unit.

whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TZEENTCH MUTANT unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot or declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TZEENTCH MUTANT unit from your army that is arriving from Strategic Reserves this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy units, or anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units if it is a MONSTER unit. In either case, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a RUBRICAE unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That RUBRICAE unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One RUBRICAE unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit can ignore any or all modifiers to its Move characteristic and to Advance rolls made for it, and ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the ASSAULT ability.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all inferno bolt pistols, inferno boltguns, inferno combi‑bolters and inferno combi‑weapons equipped by models in your unit have the PSYCHIC ability and a Strength characteristic of 5.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after a THOUSAND SONS PSYKER model from your army is destroyed.
targetRules: One RUBRICAE unit from your army that was within 6" of that PSYKER model when it was destroyed.
effectRules: After the attacking unit has shot, your RUBRICAE unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when resolving those attacks it can only target the enemy unit that just destroyed your PSYKER model (and only if it is an eligible target).

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One RUBRIC MARINES PSYKER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit (excluding PSYKER models), subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
targetRules: One RUBRIC MARINES unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is mutated, and remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase. While an objective marker is mutated and under your control, each time an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move within range of that objective marker, roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a THOUSAND SONS VEHICLE unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That VEHICLE unit, and one friendly THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit within 6" of that VEHICLE unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your VEHICLE unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

whenRules: Your Command phase
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS VEHICLE unit from your army within 6" of one or more friendly THOUSAND SONS PSYKER units.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, your VEHICLE unit is malevolent. While a unit is malevolent, it can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: the profile characteristics of its models; the Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill characteristics of weapons equipped by its models; any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS VEHICLE unit from your army within 6" of one or more friendly THOUSAND SONS PSYKER units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by VEHICLE models in your unit have the PSYCHIC ability and each time an attack is made with such a weapon, add 1 to the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS VEHICLE unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound. That enemy unit must then take a Battle-shock test.

whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all attacks made against your unit with Psychic weapons have the HAZARDOUS ability and all models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic Attacks.

whenRules: Any phase, when a saving throw is failed for a THOUSAND SONS PSYKER model from your army.
targetRules: That PSYKER model.
effectRules: Change the Damage characteristic of that attack to 0.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Imbued Manifestation, Psychic Maelstrom or Wrath of the Immaterium ability (see Kindred Sorcery). Until the start of your next Command phase, that ability applies to your unit instead of any other Kindred Sorcery ability, even if you have already selected that ability this battle.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your Shooting phase, just after you take a Psychic test for a THOUSAND SONS model from your army that Channelled the Warp (before resolving that Ritual).
targetRules: That THOUSAND SONS model.
effectRules: Re-roll all of the D6 rolled for that Psychic test (including the additional D6 for Channelling the Warp).

whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Psychic Attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS or SCINTILLATING LEGIONS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement Range of your unit selects targets for its attacks, it can only target your unit if there are no eligible SCINTILLATING LEGIONS targets for those attacks.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One SCINTILLATING LEGIONS unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", or a Normal move of up to 6" instead if it is wholly within 6" of one or more friendly THOUSAND SONS units.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One SCINTILLATING LEGIONS unit from your army (excluding MONSTERS) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One THOUSAND SONS PSYKER or SCINTILLATING LEGIONS unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two SCINTILLATING LEGIONS units from your army (excluding MONSTERS), or one SCINTILLATING LEGIONS MONSTER unit from your army, if all of those units are more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy units.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.

lore: Prey stare in horror as chitinous armour regrows and flesh, muscle and sinew knots back together as though never harmed.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability. If your unit is within Synapse Range of your army, until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability instead.

lore: Tyranids care nothing for self-preservation, lashing out even in death.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: These warrior organisms destroy all as their adrenaline surges.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Tyranids units from your army that are within Synapse Range of your army and are eligible to fight, or one other Tyranids unit from your army that is eligible to fight.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of those selected units makes an attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Tyranids are an unstoppable avalanche of flesh and chitin.
whenRules: Fight phase, just before a Tyranids unit from your army Consolidates.
targetRules: That Tyranids unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit can end its Consolidation move in Unit Coherency and within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units. If your unit is within Synapse Range of your army and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, instead of making that Consolidation move, it can instead make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Guided by the instincts of leader-beasts, a portion of the swarm can be tasked with focusing its hunting instincts to destroy a particular foe.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Up to two Tyranids units from your army that are within Synapse Range of your army, or one other Tyranids unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one Hyper-adaptation. Until the end of the battle round, that hyper-adaptation is active for those selected units in addition to any other that may be active for your army.
restrictionRules: You cannot select the same hyper-adaptation you selected at the start of the first battle round.

lore: As the battle rages, more organisms pour in to bolster the swarms.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: Up to two Endless Multitude units from your army that are within Synapse Range of your army, or one other Endless Multitude unit from your army.
effectRules: Up to D3+3 destroyed models are returned to each of the selected units.

lore: Highly acidic fluids spray from the creature’s wounds, lethal to those nearby.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after a TYRANIDS MONSTER model from your army with the Deadly Demise ability that cannot FLY is destroyed.
targetRules: That TYRANIDS MONSTER model. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not roll one D6 to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by your model’s Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted.

lore: Tyranid monsters have reserves of energy that they unleash in waves of devastating fury.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS MONSTER unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

lore: This monster is even more terrifying to behold than other bioforms of its kind.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS MONSTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test and, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. If that Battle-shock test was failed, subtract 1 from the Wound roll as well.

lore: Encircling and entrapping such physically powerful and fearless beasts is nigh on impossible.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS MONSTER unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules:
Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move through models (excluding Titanic models) and sections of terrain features that are 4" or less in height. When doing so:

■ It can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.
■ It can also move through sections of terrain features that are more than 4" in height, but if it does, after its unit has moved, roll one D6: on a 1, your unit is Battle-shocked.

lore: One cannot hide from a gestalt entity with a million eyes, even in the densest cover.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS MONSTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and until the end of the phase each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that model’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.

lore: Employing their sheer bulk and vicious chitinous horns and spikes, the largest Tyranids crash headlong through the foe, often with devastating results.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a TYRANIDS MONSTER model from your army ends a Charge move.
targetRules: That TYRANIDS MONSTER model.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your model and roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: For a moment, a minuscule sliver of the Hive Mind’s ineffable will is focussed through these warrior organisms, driving them to pounce upon either valuable prey or else some vital strategic target.
whenRules: Any phase, just before an ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army that is within Synapse Range of your army makes a Surge move.
targetRules: That ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit.
effectRules: When making that Surge move, you can re-roll the D6 to determine how far your unit moves, and your unit can end that move as close as possible to the closest objective marker (instead of as close as possible to the closest enemy unit]. All other rules for making Surge moves still apply.

lore: No matter how many warrior organisms are slain, more are already surging forward over their corpses.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.
restrictionRules: Any destroyed CHARACTER units that were attached to your unit are not returned.

lore: Skittering, darting and pouring over one another, the Tyranids make for hard and confusing targets.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: The sheer weight of Tyranid numbers begins to tell as they bury their victims in lashing, biting horror.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, and If your unit contains 15 or more models, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Synaptic impulses from the Hive Mind urge greater speed from the swarm’s warrior organisms.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Triggered by incoming projectile fire, a synaptic pulse spurs the danger-senses of lesser warrior organisms and causes them to scatter like a shoal evading predators. Only once the explosions have stopped and the dust cleared do the bioforms bunch up once again.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One ENDLESS MULTITUDE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is treated as containing fewer than five models for the purpose of the [BLAST] ability.

lore: Should a foe successfully slay one of the swarm’s assimilation organisms, they only mark themselves as a priority for predation and consumption in turn.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One HARVESTER unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly TYRANIDS model makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your HARVESTER unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Dead Tyranids are consumed and reconstituted by the swarm just as readily as the lifeless carcasses of their prey.
whenRules: Any phase, when a TYRANIDS unit from your army is destroyed, before the last model in it is removed from play.
targetRules: One HARVESTER unit from your army that is within 6" of that destroyed unit.
effectRules: Regenerate one friendly TYRANIDS unit within 6" of your HARVESTER unit (See Feed the Swarm).

lore: Swarms of diminutive Tyranid phage organisms carpet even the most vital strategic assets, steadily breaking them down for assimilation.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One HARVESTER unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: These organisms have employed consumed minerals to exude an additional hardened protective layer over their chitinous armour.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One HARVESTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability. If your unit is within range of an objective marker you control, until the end of the phase models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability instead.

lore: When rich sources of biomass are identified the warrior organisms of this swarm will stop at nothing to destroy resistance and claim them.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. If your unit is a HARVESTER unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit as well.

lore: The hunger of the Tyranids can never be satiated.
whenRules: Your Fight phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that just destroyed an enemy unit.
effectRules: Your unit immediately Regenerates (See Feed the Swarm). When doing so, if your unit is a HARVESTER unit and you choose for one model to regain up to D3 lost wounds, that model regains up to 3 lost wounds instead.

lore: Vanguard organisms strike from unexpected quarters with calculated and emotionless alien savagery that is appalling to behold.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One VANGUARD INVADER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit.
effectRules: That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, add 1 to the Hit roll. If the Battle-shock test was failed, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

lore: These bioforms have been adapted to strike with pinpoint precision at the pre-assessed weak points of selected prey that require elimination.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One VANGUARD INVADER INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: Warrior organisms erupt from concealment straight into advanced positions.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is in Reserves, or up to two VANGUARD INVADER units from your army that are in Reserves.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, for the purposes of setting up those selected units on the battlefield, treat the current battle round number as being one higher than it actually is.

lore: Hissing clusters of scillia warn of the slightest prey movements, allowing the Tyranids to react.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: Up to two VANGUARD INVADER units from your army that are within 9" of that enemy unit, or one other TYRANIDS INFANTRY unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Those selected units can each make a Normal move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot target units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Hyper-attuned senses warn vanguard organisms when they are being targeted by the prey.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One VANGUARD INVADER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18" or, if your unit has the Lone Operative ability, if the attacking model is within 6". Your opponent can select new targets for the attacking unit's attacks.

lore: Hunter-slayer organisms can melt away before the eyes of their foes, only to strike from a new direction.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two VANGUARD INVADER units from your army, or one TYRANIDS INFANTRY unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: The targeted units must be more than 3" away from all enemy units.

lore: In the heart of the swarms, the Shadow in the Warp can literally kill with its smothering power.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test.
targetRules: One SYNAPSE unit from your army within 12" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6: for each 3+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: Tyranids are one with the Hive Mind; individuality is a disadvantage that they surpass.
whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One SYNAPSE unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, while a friendly TYRANIDS unit is within 9" of the selected unit, that unit is within Synapse Range of your army.

lore: Whether paralysing its prey or forcing them to stumble out of cover with its force of will, or else puppeteering nearby warrior organisms, the leader-beast ensures the prey targets are struck down.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One SYNAPSE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit within 24" of and visible to the SYNAPSE unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly TYRANIDS model makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, if the attacking model’s unit is within 6" of your SYNAPSE unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1 and re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

lore: Psionic shielding crackles around these leader-beasts, helping to ensure their survival.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One SYNAPSE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: At need, the focused will of the Tyranid leader-beasts can goad warrior organisms to exhibit strategically beneficial behaviours at the instant they are needed most.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is within Synapse Range of your army.
effectRules: Select one Synaptic Imperative, even if you have already selected that imperative this battle. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Synaptic Imperative is active for your unit instead of any other Synaptic Imperative that is active for your army.

lore: The seemingly omniscient Hive Mind processes the sensory input of its swarms at an impossible rate, and compels its broods to react accordingly.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is within Synapse Range of your army and made a Fall Back move this phase.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge this turn.

lore: Tyranid Warriors focus and amplify the urgency of the Hive Mind’s impulse to nearby broods, lending them increased coordination.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: If that unit is a Tyranid Warriors unit, select up to one Endless Multitude unit from your army, that is not Battle‑shocked, within 6" of it. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in those units makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1, and, if it is a Tyranid Warriors unit, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1 as well.

lore: Biomorphic symbiotes growing beneath the chitinous plates of some Tyranids can be activated by synaptic impulse, acidifying their bio‑weapons at a moment’s notice.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Tyranids unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit and add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by Tyranid Warriors and Winged Tyranid Prime models in your unit.

lore: Responding to impulses from the Hive Mind, dormant nanoviral organisms awaken within the corpse of a fallen Tyranid Warrior, knitting together ruptured organs and restoring its broken form to life.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tyranid Warriors unit from your army that is below its Starting Strength.
effectRules: Return 1 destroyed model (excluding Character models) to your unit.

lore: Impulses from the Hive Mind compel its most adaptable bioforms to shed microbial micronodes that burrow into the soil, knitting together to form a short‑term synaptic relay that persists only as long as the brief‑burning lifespans of its composite creatures.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Tyranid Warriors unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

lore: The projectiles fired by this weapon are infected with parasites that burrow into the central nervous systems of their targets, causing them to wail and scream in pain and giving away their position to the oncoming swarms.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Tyranid Warriors with Ranged Bio‑weapons unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability. After your unit has resolved its shooting attacks this phase, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the turn, models in that unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.

lore: By focusing the psionic energies of the Hive Mind, these leader‑beasts shield the teeming bioforms under their command.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Tyranid Warriors unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: If that unit is a Tyranid Warriors unit, select up to one Endless Multitude unit from your army, that is not Battle‑shocked, within 6" of it. Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack targets one of those units, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Command phase.
targetRules: One MAWLOC or TRYGON unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, your unit has the SYNAPSE keyword.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army, wholly within 9" of one or more Tunnel Markers you placed.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to D3+1 lost wounds, or you can return up to D3+1 destroyed models with a Wounds characteristic of 1 to your unit, with their full wounds remaining, instead.

whenRules: End of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that was set up as Reinforcements this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of your next Fight phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the SUSTAINED HITS 1 and IGNORES COVER abilities.

whenRules: End of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more of your Tunnel Markers.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and set it up again, wholly within 9" of another Tunnel Marker you placed, and more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.

whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS MONSTER unit from your army that was set up as Reinforcements this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, friendly TYRANIDS units within 6" of your unit can re-roll Charge rolls.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit or up to two BURROWER units from your army that are not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of one or more objective markers you controlled at the end of the previous phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Select one of those objective markers. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase and that made a charge move this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a WORLD EATERS unit from your army destroys a CHARACTER or MONSTER model.
targetRules: That WORLD EATERS unit.
effectRules: Make a Blessings of Khorne roll and use the results to activate one Blessing of Khorne. Until the end of the battle round, that Blessing of Khorne is active in addition to any other Blessings of Khorne that are currently active.

whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a KHORNE BERZERKERS unit from your army is selected to Advance.
targetRules: That KHORNE BERZERKERS unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One KHORNE BERZERKERS unit from your army that can make a Blood Surge move as a result of those attacks.
effectRules: Do not roll a D6 to determine how far models in your unit can move when they make their Blood Surge move. Instead, when making their Blood Surge move, these models can move up to 8".

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One KHORNE BERZERKERS or JAKHALS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase and is within 8" of one or more friendly WORLD EATERS CHARACTER models.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of melee weapons equipped by non‑CHARACTER models in your unit by 1.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS INFANTRY, WORLD EATERS MOUNTED or WORLD EATERS DAEMON PRINCE unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy models with a melee attack this phase.
effectRules: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent's Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS INFANTRY or WORLD EATERS DAEMON PRINCE unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: When that enemy unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if your unit is a VESSEL OF WRATH unit, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS INFANTRY, WORLD EATERS MOUNTED or WORLD EATERS DAEMON PRINCE unit from your army that lost one or more wounds as a result of those attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Blood Surge move. To do so, roll one D6: models in your unit move a number of inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. If your unit is a KHORNE BERZERKERS or VESSEL OF WRATH unit, you can re‑roll the D6 to determine how far your unit can move.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll, or, if it is a VESSEL OF WRATH unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll instead.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS MONSTER or WORLD EATERS TITANIC unit from your army that was just destroyed by an enemy unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a model in a JAKHALS or GOREMONGERS unit from your army makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One JAKHALS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One JAKHALS or GOREMONGERS unit from your army that was selected as the target as one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability. If your unit is within 6" of one or more friendly WORLD EATERS MONSTER units, or within 9" of one or more friendly WORLD EATERS TITANIC units, your unit has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability instead.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One JAKHALS or GOREMONGERS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase and is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit is selected to fight, when determining which models in it are eligible to fight, any models in your unit that are within 3" of one or more enemy models are eligible to fight. When resolving those attacks, such models can target one of those enemy units that is within 3" of them and within Engagement Range of their unit.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One JAKHALS or GOREMONGERS unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If that model's unit is within 6" of one or more friendly WORLD EATERS MONSTER units, or within 9" of one or more friendly WORLD EATERS TITANIC units, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS MONSTER or WORLD EATERS TITANIC unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Idol of Infinite Rage, Idol of Burning Wrath or Idol of Blessed Blood. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Idols of Khorne ability is active for your unit instead of any other Idols of Khorne ability that is active for your army, even if you have already selected that ability this battle.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.

whenRules: Any phase, when the last model in a unit is destroyed, before removing it from play.
targetRules: One BLOODLETTERS unit from your army that is in Reserves.
effectRules: Set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 9" of that destroyed model and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, then remove the destroyed model from play.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle round.

whenRules: Start of your Fight phase.
targetRules: One BLOOD LEGIONS unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one friendly WORLD EATERS unit within 6" of your unit. Until the end of the turn, melee weapons equipped by models in your WORLD EATERS unit have the LANCE ability. If the Daemonic Rage ability is active for your army, then until the end of the phase those melee weapons also have the TWIN-LINKED ability.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after a BLOOD LEGIONS or WORLD EATERS unit from your army has fought, and one or more enemy CHARACTER or MONSTER models were destroyed as a result of those attacks.
targetRules: That BLOOD LEGIONS or WORLD EATERS unit.
effectRules: You gain D3BTP and you can then spend one or more BTP you have to activate one of the Blood Tithe abilities.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One BLOOD LEGIONS unit from your army that is within 6" of a friendly WORLD EATERS unit that was selected as the target as one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your WORLD EATERS unit have a 5+ invulnerable save. If the Boon of Blood ability is active for your army, then until the end of the phase, models in your WORLD EATERS unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one friendly BLOOD LEGIONS unit within 6" of your unit. One destroyed MOUNTED model, up to D3 destroyed BEAST models, or up to D6 destroyed INFANTRY models are returned to that BLOOD LEGIONS unit with their full wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER models to Attached units.

whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One BLOOD LEGIONS unit from your army that is on the battlefield and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS POSSESSED unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS POSSESSED unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack made by a model in your unit is allocated to an enemy model, if your unit has the EIGHTBOUND keyword and that enemy model is not a MONSTER or VEHICLE, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack. If your unit has the EXALTED EIGHTBOUND keyword and that enemy model is a MONSTER or VEHICLE, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack instead.

whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS POSSESSED unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One EXALTED EIGHTBOUND unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy units.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS POSSESSED unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declare a charge this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through enemy models (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but, unless that move was a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed.

whenRules: Your opponent's Command phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS POSSESSED unit from your army.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test.

whenRules: End of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS INFANTRY unit from your army and one friendly TRANSPORT that it is able to embark within.
effectRules: If your WORLD EATERS INFANTRY unit is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS VEHICLE model from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal or Advance move, it can move horizontally through terrain features.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS RHINO model from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: One WORLD EATERS unit embarked within your RHINO can disembark. When doing so, models in that unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6" of your RHINO and can be set up within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS RHINO model from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a WORLD EATERS unit disembarks from that model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One WORLD EATERS VEHICLE model from your army that was hit by one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Your model can make a Normal move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: A unit cannot be targeted by this Stratagem and the Fury Unleashed Stratagem in the same phase.

whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
